issue.title: Add OptionsResolver::configureOptions()
issue.body: **Description**  rnWhen we want to configure an option in OptionsResolver, we have a code like this one:rn```phprn$optionsResolverrn    ->setDefined('foo')rn    ->setAllowedTypes('foo', ['string'])rn    ->setAllowedValues('foo', ['bar', 'baz'])rn    ->setRequired('foo');rn```rnWe have to duplicate option name and call 4 or 5 methods for each option to configure.rnrnWith only one option, it's readable, but when we have more options it's difficult to read.rnrnCan we add a method with most used configurations?rnrn```phprn$optionsResolver = new OptionsResolver();rnrn# Configure a required option rn$optionsResolver->configureRequiredOption('foo', ['string'], ['bar', 'baz']);rnrn# Equivalent to call original OptionsResolver methods:rn$optionsResolverrn    ->setDefined('foo')rn    ->setAllowedTypes('foo', ['string'])rn    ->setAllowedValues('foo', ['bar', 'baz'])rn    ->setRequired('foo');rn```rnrn**Example** rnI don't know if I can add a link here, my bad if it's not allowed.rnrnI've done it in a public repository:rnhttps://github.com/steevanb/symfony-options-resolverrnrn

issue.title: Improve the HttpClient panel in the Web Profiler
issue.body: PR #33015 introduces a profiler panel for the HttpClient component.rnIt was decided to merge it and improve it in nex iterations.rnrnHere are the ideas that would be great to contribute, help wante:rn- the panel UI could be improved I suppose, e.g. a tooltip on hover in the toolbarrn- putting requests in the 'Performance' tab would be great (all timings are already in the collected 'info')rn- response bodies are not collected yetrn- when a transport error occurs, (ie the 'error' info is populated) we should maybe have a better display too?rn- add a copy-as-curl button next to each requestrn

issue.title: [MAILER] Let Amazon Mailer use the AWS SDK if available
issue.body: A big advantage of using the AWS SDK - if installed - is that no credentials need to be recorded in the environment variables when the application is installed on AWS infrastructure, and a so-called Instance Profile is setup for the EC2 infrastructure being used.rnrnThe AWS SDK can work with credentials, but default to the Instance Profile to determine the available permissions, as set in the IAM configuration of your AWS account. When your application is heavily dependent on AWS services, all permissions are maintained in the Instance Profile instead of using a multitude of AWS keys & secrets.rnrnA proposal is to use http://ses or smtp://ses whenever you don't wish to use AWS keys & secrets.

issue.title: Normalize the format used in CHANGELOG and UPGRADE files
issue.body: The format used in those files greatly vary and different core team members have different expectations for them.rnrnSometimes it's on the case : rnrn- `Added x`rn- `added x`rnrnOr on the final point : rnrn- `Removed y`rn- `Removed y.`rnrnOr 'the way' we write recurring themes such as deprecations : rnrn- `Deprecated X, use Y.`rn- `The X class has been deprecated, please use Y`rn- `X is deprecated since Symfony 4.4, use Y instead.`rnrnetc. etc. etc.rnrnWhat about deciding **quickly**  on some rules that will cover most of the cases and write them down in the contributing doc ?rnrnThe gain is to stop wasting time on this subject : for reviewers so they can focus on the code and for contributors so they know how to write those messages.

issue.title: Improve a confusing error about fragments/hinclude/templating
issue.body: **Symfony version(s) affected**: allrnrn**Description**  rnI'm updating a Symfony app to 4.2 + Flex. I'm converting the old app/config/config.yml into the new config/packages/*.yamlrnrnWhen browsing the app, I saw this error:rnrn![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/73419/57221522-defd5a00-6fff-11e9-9a08-a42a53fd215f.png)rnrnI had this in `config/packages/framework.yaml`:rnrn```yamlrnframework:rn    # ...rnrn    fragments:rn        enabled: truern        path: '...'rn```rnrnThere's no other config option to enable/disable 'hinclude' specifically ... so I didn't know what to do.rnrnThen, luckily, I remembered that I had deleted this when doing the config file conversion:rnrn```yamlrnframework:rn    # ...rn    templating:rn        engines: ['twig']rn```rnrnAdding that solved the problem. But we should improve the error message, because it's very confusing and doesn't help find the solution. Thanks!rn

Thanks!rnrn-----rnrn**Symfony version(s) affected**: 3.4rnrn**Description**rnrnThe `src/Symfony/Component/Validator/Resources/translations/validators.zh_TW.xlf` file is missing the following translations compared to the original English file:rnrn```xmlrn<trans-unit id='73'>rn    <source>The image ratio is too big ({{ ratio }}). Allowed maximum ratio is {{ max_ratio }}.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='74'>rn    <source>The image ratio is too small ({{ ratio }}). Minimum ratio expected is {{ min_ratio }}.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='75'>rn    <source>The image is square ({{ width }}x{{ height }}px). Square images are not allowed.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='76'>rn    <source>The image is landscape oriented ({{ width }}x{{ height }}px). Landscape oriented images are not allowed.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='77'>rn    <source>The image is portrait oriented ({{ width }}x{{ height }}px). Portrait oriented images are not allowed.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='78'>rn    <source>An empty file is not allowed.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='79'>rn    <source>The host could not be resolved.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='80'>rn    <source>This value does not match the expected {{ charset }} charset.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='81'>rn    <source>This is not a valid Business Identifier Code (BIC).</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='82'>rn    <source>Error</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='83'>rn    <source>This is not a valid UUID.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='84'>rn    <source>This value should be a multiple of {{ compared_value }}.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='85'>rn    <source>This Business Identifier Code (BIC) is not associated with IBAN {{ iban }}.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='86'>rn    <source>This value should be valid JSON.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='87'>rn    <source>This collection should contain only unique elements.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='88'>rn    <source>This value should be positive.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='89'>rn    <source>This value should be either positive or zero.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='90'>rn    <source>This value should be negative.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='91'>rn    <source>This value should be either negative or zero.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='92'>rn    <source>This value is not a valid timezone.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='93'>rn    <source>This password has been leaked in a data breach, it must not be used. Please use another password.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='94'>rn    <source>This value should be between {{ min }} and {{ max }}.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn```rnrn**Possible Solution**rnrnA Pull Request must be sent to Symfony's 3.4 branch adding the missing translations.rnrnDon't forget to take a quick look at the existing translations to use the same tone and style in the new translations.rnrn**Additional context**rnrnYou have two ways to make this contribution:rnrn**1)** Use the GitHub web interface to edit the translation and make the pull request.rnrn  * It's recommended if you don't have any experience using Git in the terminal.rn  * To do so, [click here](https://github.com/symfony/symfony/edit/3.4/src/Symfony/Component/Validator/Resources/translations/validators.zh_TW.xlf) to edit the translation file and follow the given steps to create the pull request.rnrn**2)** Use your own editor to edit the translation file and use the Git commands in the terminal to make the pull request.rnrn  * It's the most common way to contribute to Symfony.rn  * You need to download Symfony's code to your computer and follow the steps explained [in this contribution guide](https://symfony.com/doc/current/contributing/code/patches.html)rnrn-----rnrnIf you need any help during the contribution process, visit the `#contribs` channel on [Symfony Slack](https://symfony.com/slack) where we'll be happy to help you.

issue.title: lint:yaml command as a separated package
issue.body: Currently, if we want to use the `lint:yaml` command, we can only do this on a Symfony Full Stack installation, or require FrameworkBundle and add the command under a self made application file.nnIt would be great if we can have this one as a binary, like php-cs-fixer for example.nnThis would be useful to integrate it under Travis for example, for our bundles.nnAn equivalent already exists for Ruby: https://github.com/Pryz/yaml-lintnnOr maybe move it under the yaml component?nnWhat do you think?n

issue.title: [String] Add tests for replaceMatches()
issue.body: **Symfony version(s) affected**: 5.0rnrn**Description**  rnI can't find tests (or a method description) for the method `String:replaceMatches()`. Its behavior is more complex than it looks at first sight, so it's important to do this.rn

issue.title: [WebProfiler] Deprecate `intercept_redirects` in 4.4, remove it in 5.0
issue.body: The `intercept_redirects` option is not needed anymore as the toolbar for the redirected resource now contains a link to the redirect response profile. For this reason, this option is set to `false` by default.rnrnI think that this feature is not needed anymore and should be deprecated in 4.4 so that we can remove it in 5.0.rnrn

issue.title: [VarDumper] ImageCaster lacks tests
issue.body: **Symfony version(s) affected**: 4.4rnrn**Description**  rnhttps://github.com/symfony/symfony/pull/32683 introduced a new ImageCaster on top of `imagine/image`. rnProblem is that the feature is not tested at all, and optional features that rely on external vendors must particularly be tested (allows for early detection of incompatible versions etc..).rnrn**How to reproduce**  rnrnrn**Possible Solution**  rnAdd `imagine/image` to the VarDumper dev-requirements and write a unit test for the ImageCaster (see other caster test cases for inspiration).rnrn**Additional context**  rn<!-- Optional: any other context about the problem: log messages, screenshots, etc. -->rn

issue.title: PHP 7.4 + PHPUnit 8.2 support
issue.body: ~In #32842, I implemented a new `ForwardCompatTestTrait` in the phpunit-bridge to allow tests to run on the new php74-snapshot job, see #32289  This trait adds the `void` return type that phpunit 8 requires, while preserving compatibility with branch 3.4, which supports PHP 5.5. As a reminder, we target to make 3.4 run on PHP 7.4.~rnrnAs of #32882, the phpunit-bridge is able to run phpunit 4.8 to 8 and PHP 5.5 to 7.4. It does so by polyfilling some missing methods and by patching the return type of setUp*/tearDown* methods when needed.rnrnNow, there are failures we need to overcome on PHP 7.4 + phpunit 8, as reported here:rnhttps://travis-ci.org/symfony/symfony/jobs/567908746rnrn~We need to implement polyfill methods in `ForwardCompatTestTrait` to allow fixing the deprecation warnings that phpunit 8 displays.~rnrnWith #32887 in place, the process would be:rn1. open a PR against branch 4.4 to make the phpunit-bridge polyfill a missing feature when neededrn2. open a PR against branch 3.4 with the fix applied, and with the `SYMFONY_PHPUNIT_BRIDGE_PR` set to the number of the previous PR in `.travis.yaml`rn3. we'll merge 1. once things are validated, and you'll have to revert the change on `.travis.yaml` before we merge 2.rnrnHere is the list of things that phpunit 8 reports and should be fixed:rn- [x] #32969 The optional $checkForObjectIdentity parameter of assert(Not)Contains() is deprecated and will be removed in PHPUnit 9. Refactor your test to use assert(Not)ContainsEquals() instead.rn- [x] #32968 The optional $delta parameter of assertEquals() is deprecated and will be removed in PHPUnit 9. Refactor your test to use assertEqualsWithDelta() instead.rn- [x] #32971 Using assert(Not)Contains() with string haystacks is deprecated and will not be supported in PHPUnit 9. Refactor your test to use assertString(Not)ContainsString() or assertString(Not)ContainsStringIgnoringCase() instead.rn- [x] #32923 readAttribute()/getObjectAttribute()/assertAttributeEquals()/assertAttributeSame() is deprecated and will be removed in PHPUnit 9.rn- [x] #32909 assertArraySubset() is deprecated and will be removed in PHPUnit 9.rn- [x] #32878 #32907 polyfill assertString(Not)ContainsString(IgnoringCase), assertEqualsWithDelta and assert(Not)ContainsEqualsrn- [x] #32875 The @expectedException, @expectedExceptionCode, @expectedExceptionMessage, and @expectedExceptionMessageRegExp annotations are deprecated. They will be removed in PHPUnit 9. Refactor your test to use expectException(), expectExceptionCode(), expectExceptionMessage(), or expectExceptionMessageRegExp() instead.rn- [x] #32846 assertInternalType() is deprecated and will be removed in PHPUnit 9. Refactor your test to use assertIsArray(), assertIsBool(), assertIsFloat(), assertIsInt(), assertIsNumeric(), assertIsObject(), assertIsResource(), assertIsString(), assertIsScalar(), assertIsCallable(), or assertIsIterable() instead.rn- [x] #32865 Declaration of ...::createMock($classname) must be compatible with PHPUnitFrameworkTestCase::createMockrn- [x] #32854 add `void` return types on branch 4.3+ where setup/teardown methods are still usedrn- [x] https://github.com/php-cache/integration-tests/pull/102 do the same with 3rd party deps that we usernrnAnd fix PHP 7.4 deprecations:rn- [x] #32981 Invalid characters passed for attempted conversionrn- [x] #32981 Trying to access array offset on value of type [...]rn- [x] #32981 array_key_exists(): Using array_key_exists() on objects is deprecated. Use isset() or property_exists() insteadrn- [x] #32992 Function ReflectionType::__toString() is deprecatedrn- [x] #32862 Uncaught TypeError: abs() expects parameter 1 to be int or float, string givenrn- [x] #32862 PHP-8: Uncaught TypeError: abs() expects parameter 1 to be int or float, string givenrn- [x] #32864 skip tests that are fatal on PHP 7.4 for now - we can work on them laterrn- [x] https://github.com/twigphp/Twig/pull/3097 fix using array_key_exists() on objects in Twigrn- [x] https://github.com/doctrine/orm/pull/7785 https://github.com/doctrine/annotations/pull/258 Trying to access array offset on value of type [...]rnrnThen:rn- [x] #33000 same on 4.3rn- [x] same on 4.4/masterrn- [ ] fix #32995rnrnI'm opening this issue to ask for help to the community, this is a lot of work that can be split efficiently I believe.

issue.title: Help Wanted
issue.body: Please check https://github.com/orgs/symfony/projects/1 if you would like to contribute but don't know where to start.rnrnCore-team members can manage a list of issues they think would make Symfony move forward in a useful way. They are seeking help to close them all and are willing to help in return. Thanks in advance for anything you can do!rnrnSee also the [good first issue](https://github.com/symfony/symfony/labels/good%20first%20issue) and [help wanted](https://github.com/symfony/symfony/labels/help%20wanted) labels.

issue.title: [FrameworkBundle] Rename internal WebTestCase to avoid confusion
issue.body: **Description**  rnFrameworkBundle has two classes called `WebTestCase`:rnrn* https://github.com/symfony/symfony/blob/4.4/src/Symfony/Bundle/FrameworkBundle/Test/WebTestCase.phprn* https://github.com/symfony/symfony/blob/4.4/src/Symfony/Bundle/FrameworkBundle/Tests/Functional/WebTestCase.phprnrnThe second is only meant for our internal tests. But because it has the same-name, it's easy for a user to extend the wrong one from their own tests. There is also another internal `WebTestCase` inside SecurityBundle.rnrnHas this been discussed before? It seems like an easy win to rename this internal testing class to something else.

issue.title: [mailgun-mailer] support EU-endpoint
issue.body: Currently `symfony/mailgun-mailer` supports only the US-enpoint, but not the EU-endpoint.rnrnBasically, the endpoint needs to be changed from `api.mailgun.net` to `api.eu.mailgun.net` (see [regions in mailgun-documentation](https://documentation.mailgun.com/en/latest/api-intro.html#mailgun-regions). There should be an option in the dsn to switch from us to eu.

issue.title: The default message bus name should start with `messenger.`
issue.body: Currently, the default bus name in the container is `message_bus`. It should probably be `messenger.message_bus`.rnrnWDYT @sroze @weaverryan rn

issue.title: Typo in SimpleFormAuthenticationListener
issue.body: The check https://github.com/symfony/security/blob/baa22f665a7ea04c2bfb4d6236a2020a25979f10/Http/Firewall/SimpleFormAuthenticationListener.php#L100 should be one ofrnrn```rnif (!is_string($username))rn// orrnif (!is_string($username) && !(is_object($username) && !method_exists($username, '__toString')))rn```rnrnAs currently written, the second condition will always be false.rnrnNoticed this while looking into an opcache optimization bug caused by this piece of code :)

issue.title: [Validator] Fix a repeated error code in a Constraint class
issue.body: **IMPORTANT**: **this issue is reserved for new contributors**, because we want to give the opportunity to people who want to contribute to Symfony but never found the right first issue to fix.rnrnIf you want to work on this issue, add a comment to assign it to yourself and let others know that this is already taken. Thanks!rnrn- - - - -rnrn### ContextrnrnEach Symfony Validator Constraint class define several errors. Each error is defined as a constant whose value is an arbitrary UUID code.rnrn### Bug descriptionrnrnIn Symfony 3.4 there is a bug because the `TOO_HIGH_ERROR` constant has the same value in two different constraints: `LessThan` and `LessThanOrEqual`.rnrn### SolutionrnrnOne of the two classes must be updated to change the value of the `TOO_HIGH_ERROR` constant. You can pick any arbitrary UUID value for the new constant value.rnrnYou must do the change in the Symfony 3.4 branch and we'll merge it later automatically in all the other branches.rnrn### DetailsrnrnYou have two ways to make this contribution:rnrn**1)** Use the GitHub web interface to edit the constraint class and make the pull request.rnrn* It's recommended if you don't have any experience using Git in the terminal.rn* We prefer if you don't use this method ... because it's limited and you won't learn much from it.rnrn**2)** Use your own editor to edit the constraint class and use the Git commands in the terminal to make the pull request.rnrn* It's the most common way to contribute to Symfony.rn* You need to download Symfony's code to your computer and follow the steps explained [in this contribution guide](https://symfony.com/doc/current/contributing/code/patches.html)rnrn-----rnrnIf you need any help solving this bug, you can ask its assigned mentor: [Javier Eguiluz](https://connect.symfony.com/profile/javier.eguiluz) via [Symfony Slack](https://symfony.com/slack) private messages or via email (`javier.eguiluz@symfony.com`).rn

}}.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rnrn```rnrn**Possible Solution**rnrnA Pull Request must be sent to Symfony's 3.4 branch adding the missing translations.rnrnDon't forget to take a You need to download Symfony's code to your computer and follow the steps explained [in this contribution guide](https://symfony.com/doc/current/contributing/code/patches.html)rnrn-----rnrnIf you need issue.title: [Validator] Add the missing translations for the Tagalog ('tl') locale
issue.body: **IMPORTANT**: this issue is reserved for new contributors, because we want to give the opportunity to people who want to contribute to Symfony but never found the right issue to do that.rnrnIf you want to work on this issue, add a comment to assign it to yourself and let others know that this is already taken. Thanks!rnrn-----rnrn**Symfony version(s) affected**: 3.4rnrn**Description**rnrnThe `src/Symfony/Component/Validator/Resources/translations/validators.tl.xlf` file is missing the following translations compared to the original English file:rnrn```xmlrn<trans-unit id='82'>rn    <source>Error</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='83'>rn    <source>This is not a valid UUID.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='84'>rn    <source>This value should be a multiple of {{ compared_value }}.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='85'>rn    <source>This Business Identifier Code (BIC) is not associated with IBAN {{ iban }}.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='86'>rn    <source>This value should be valid JSON.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='87'>rn    <source>This collection should contain only unique elements.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='88'>rn    <source>This value should be positive.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='89'>rn    <source>This value should be either positive or zero.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='90'>rn    <source>This value should be negative.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='91'>rn    <source>This value should be either negative or zero.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='92'>rn    <source>This value is not a valid timezone.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='93'>rn    <source>This password has been leaked in a data breach, it must not be used. Please use another password.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn```rnrn**Possible Solution**rnrnA Pull Request must be sent to Symfony's 3.4 branch adding the missing translations.rnrnDon't forget to take a quick look at the existing translations to use the same tone and style in the new translations.rnrn**Additional context**rnrnYou have two ways to make this contribution:rnrn**1)** Use the GitHub web interface to edit the translation and make the pull request.rnrn  * It's recommended if you don't have any experience using Git in the terminal.rn  * To do so, [click here](https://github.com/symfony/symfony/edit/3.4/src/Symfony/Component/Validator/Resources/translations/validators.tl.xlf) to edit the translation file and follow the given steps to create the pull request.rnrn**2)** Use your own editor to edit the translation file and use the Git commands in the terminal to make the pull request.rnrn  * It's the most common way to contribute to Symfony.rn  * You need to download Symfony's code to your computer and follow the steps explained [in this contribution guide](https://symfony.com/doc/current/contributing/code/patches.html)rnrn-----rnrnIf you need any help during the contribution process, visit the `#contribs` channel on [Symfony Slack](https://symfony.com/slack) where we'll be happy to help you.

issue.body: If you want to work on this issue, add a comment to assign it to yourself and let others know that this is already taken. Thanks!rnrn-----rnrn**Symfony version(s) affected**: 3.4rnrn**Description**rnrnThe `src/Symfony/Component/Validator/Resources/translations/validators.sk.xlf` file is missing the following translations compared to the original English file:rnrn```xmlrn<trans-unit id='82'>rn    <source>Error</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='83'>rn    <source>This is not a valid UUID.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='84'>rn    <source>This value should be a multiple of {{ compared_value }}.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='85'>rn    <source>This Business Identifier Code (BIC) is not associated with IBAN {{ iban }}.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='86'>rn    <source>This value should be valid JSON.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='87'>rn    <source>This collection should contain only unique elements.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='88'>rn    <source>This value should be positive.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='89'>rn    <source>This value should be either positive or zero.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='90'>rn    <source>This value should be negative.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='91'>rn    <source>This value should be either negative or zero.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='92'>rn    <source>This value is not a valid timezone.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='93'>rn    <source>This password has been leaked in a data breach, it must not be used. Please use another password.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='94'>rn    <source>This value should be between {{ min }} and {{ max }}.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn```rnrn**Possible Solution**rnrnA Pull Request must be sent to Symfony's 3.4 branch adding the missing translations.rnrnDon't forget to take a quick look at the existing translations to use the same tone and style in the new translations.rnrn**Additional context**rnrnYou have two ways to make this contribution:rnrn**1)** Use the GitHub web interface to edit the translation and make the pull request.rnrn  * It's recommended if you don't have any experience using Git in the terminal.rn  * To do so, [click here](https://github.com/symfony/symfony/edit/3.4/src/Symfony/Component/Validator/Resources/translations/validators.sk.xlf) to edit the translation file and follow the given steps to create the pull request.rnrn**2)** Use your own editor to edit the translation file and use the Git commands in the terminal to make the pull request.rnrn  * It's the most common way to contribute to Symfony.rn  * You need to download Symfony's code to your computer and follow the steps explained [in this contribution guide](https://symfony.com/doc/current/contributing/code/patches.html)rnrn-----rnrnIf you need any help during the contribution process, visit the `#contribs` channel on [Symfony Slack](https://symfony.com/slack) where we'll be happy to help you.

Thanks!rnrn-----rnrn**Symfony version(s) affected**: 3.4rnrn**Description**rnrnThe `src/Symfony/Component/Validator/Resources/translations/validators.lt.xlf` file is missing the following translations compared to the original English file:rnrn```xmlrn<trans-unit id='79'>rn    <source>The host could not be resolved.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='80'>rn    <source>This value does not match the expected {{ charset }} charset.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='81'>rn    <source>This is not a valid Business Identifier Code (BIC).</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='83'>rn    <source>This is not a valid UUID.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='84'>rn    <source>This value should be a multiple of {{ compared_value }}.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='85'>rn    <source>This Business Identifier Code (BIC) is not associated with IBAN {{ iban }}.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='86'>rn    <source>This value should be valid JSON.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn```rnrn**Possible Solution**rnrnA Pull Request must be sent to Symfony's 3.4 branch adding the missing translations.rnrnDon't forget to take a quick look at the existing translations to use the same tone and style in the new translations.rnrn**Additional context**rnrnYou have two ways to make this contribution:rnrn**1)** Use the GitHub web interface to edit the translation and make the pull request.rnrn  * It's recommended if you don't have any experience using Git in the terminal.rn  * To do so, [click here](https://github.com/symfony/symfony/edit/3.4/src/Symfony/Component/Validator/Resources/translations/validators.lt.xlf) to edit the translation file and follow the given steps to create the pull request.rnrn**2)** Use your own editor to edit the translation file and use the Git commands in the terminal to make the pull request.rnrn  * It's the most common way to contribute to Symfony.rn  * You need to download Symfony's code to your computer and follow the steps explained [in this contribution guide](https://symfony.com/doc/current/contributing/code/patches.html)rnrn-----rnrnIf you need any help during the contribution process, visit the `#contribs` channel on [Symfony Slack](https://symfony.com/slack) where we'll be happy to help you.

Please use another password.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='94'>rn    <source>This value should be between {{ min }} and {{ max }}.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn```rnrn**Possible Solution**rnrnA Pull Request must be sent to Symfony's 3.4 branch adding the missing translations.rnrnDon't forget to take a quick look at the existing translations to use the same tone and style in the new translations.rnrn**Additional context**rnrnYou have two ways to make this contribution:rnrn**1)** Use the GitHub web interface to edit the translation and make the pull request.rnrn  * It's recommended if you don't have any experience using Git in the terminal.rn  * To do so, [click here](https://github.com/symfony/symfony/edit/3.4/src/Symfony/Component/Validator/Resources/translations/validators.fi.xlf) to edit the translation file and follow the given steps to create the pull request.rnrn**2)** Use your own editor to edit the translation file and use the Git commands in the terminal to make the pull request.rnrn  * It's the most common way to contribute to Symfony.rn  * You need to download Symfony's code to your computer and follow the steps explained [in this contribution guide](https://symfony.com/doc/current/contributing/code/patches.html)rnrn-----rnrnIf you need any help during the contribution process, visit the `#contribs` channel on [Symfony Slack](https://symfony.com/slack) where we'll be happy to help you.

issue.title: [Validator] Add the missing translations for the Persian ('fa') locale
issue.body: **IMPORTANT**: this issue is reserved for new contributors, because we want to give the opportunity to people who want to contribute to Symfony but never found the right issue to do that.rnrnIf you want to work on this issue, add a comment to assign it to yourself and let others know that this is already taken. Thanks!rnrn-----rnrn**Symfony version(s) affected**: 3.4rnrn**Description**rnrnThe `src/Symfony/Component/Validator/Resources/translations/validators.fa.xlf` file is missing the following translations compared to the original English file:rnrn```xmlrn<trans-unit id='73'>rn    <source>The image ratio is too big ({{ ratio }}). Allowed maximum ratio is {{ max_ratio }}.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='74'>rn    <source>The image ratio is too small ({{ ratio }}). Minimum ratio expected is {{ min_ratio }}.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='75'>rn    <source>The image is square ({{ width }}x{{ height }}px). Square images are not allowed.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='76'>rn    <source>The image is landscape oriented ({{ width }}x{{ height }}px). Landscape oriented images are not allowed.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='77'>rn    <source>The image is portrait oriented ({{ width }}x{{ height }}px). Portrait oriented images are not allowed.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='78'>rn    <source>An empty file is not allowed.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='79'>rn    <source>The host could not be resolved.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='80'>rn    <source>This value does not match the expected {{ charset }} charset.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='81'>rn    <source>This is not a valid Business Identifier Code (BIC).</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='82'>rn    <source>Error</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='83'>rn    <source>This is not a valid UUID.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='84'>rn    <source>This value should be a multiple of {{ compared_value }}.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='85'>rn    <source>This Business Identifier Code (BIC) is not associated with IBAN {{ iban }}.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rnrn```rnrn**Possible Solution**rnrnA Pull Request must be sent to Symfony's 3.4 branch adding the missing translations.rnrnDon't forget to take a quick look at the existing translations to use the same tone and style in the new translations.rnrn**Additional context**rnrnYou have two ways to make this contribution:rnrn**1)** Use the GitHub web interface to edit the translation and make the pull request.rnrn  * It's recommended if you don't have any experience using Git in the terminal.rn  * To do so, [click here](https://github.com/symfony/symfony/edit/3.4/src/Symfony/Component/Validator/Resources/translations/validators.fa.xlf) to edit the translation file and follow the given steps to create the pull request.rnrn**2)** Use your own editor to edit the translation file and use the Git commands in the terminal to make the pull request.rnrn  * It's the most common way to contribute to Symfony.rn  * You need to download Symfony's code to your computer and follow the steps explained [in this contribution guide](https://symfony.com/doc/current/contributing/code/patches.html)rnrn-----rnrnIf you need any help during the contribution process, visit the `#contribs` channel on [Symfony Slack](https://symfony.com/slack) where we'll be happy to help you.

issue.title: [Validator] Add the missing translations for the Czech ('cs') locale
issue.body: **IMPORTANT**: this issue is reserved for new contributors, because we want to give the opportunity to people who want to contribute to Symfony but never found the right issue to do that.rnrnIf you want to work on this issue, add a comment to assign it to yourself and let others know that this is already taken. Thanks!rnrn-----rnrn**Symfony version(s) affected**: 3.4rnrn**Description**rnrnThe `src/Symfony/Component/Validator/Resources/translations/validators.cs.xlf` file is missing the following translations compared to the original English file:rnrn```xmlrn<trans-unit id='83'>rn    <source>This is not a valid UUID.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='84'>rn    <source>This value should be a multiple of {{ compared_value }}.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='85'>rn    <source>This Business Identifier Code (BIC) is not associated with IBAN {{ iban }}.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn<trans-unit id='86'>rn    <source>This value should be valid JSON.</source>rn    <target>...</target>rn</trans-unit>rn```rnrn**Possible Solution**rnrnA Pull Request must be sent to Symfony's 3.4 branch adding the missing translations.rnrnDon't forget to take a quick look at the existing translations to use the same tone and style in the new translations.rnrn**Additional context**rnrnYou have two ways to make this contribution:rnrn**1)** Use the GitHub web interface to edit the translation and make the pull request.rnrn  * It's recommended if you don't have any experience using Git in the terminal.rn  * To do so, [click here](https://github.com/symfony/symfony/edit/3.4/src/Symfony/Component/Validator/Resources/translations/validators.cs.xlf) to edit the translation file and follow the given steps to create the pull request.rnrn**2)** Use your own editor to edit the translation file and use the Git commands in the terminal to make the pull request.rnrn  * It's the most common way to contribute to Symfony.rn  * You need to download Symfony's code to your computer and follow the steps explained [in this contribution guide](https://symfony.com/doc/current/contributing/code/patches.html)rnrn-----rnrnIf you need any help during the contribution process, visit the `#contribs` channel on [Symfony Slack](https://symfony.com/slack) where we'll be happy to help you.

request.rnrn**2)** Use your own editor to edit the translation file and use the Git commands in the terminal to make the pull request.rnrn  * It's the most common way to contribute to Symfony.rn  * You need to download Symfony's code to your computer and follow the steps explained [in this contribution guide](https://symfony.com/doc/current/contributing/code/patches.html)rnrn-----rnrnIf you need any help during the contribution process, visit the `#contribs` channel on [Symfony Slack](https://symfony.com/slack) where we'll be happy to help you.rn

issue.title: QuestionHelper with AutoComplete mangles multi byte characters on output
issue.body: **Symfony version(s) affected**: masterrnrn**Description** rnWe're using the QuestionHelper to read input. The Helper has an Auto Complete, and some of what we're inputting is multibyte characters like `u00e9`. rnrnWhen we do this, `u00e9` becomes: `ufffdufffd` on the command line. (In the screenshot below, I included a `d` after the `u00e9`).rnrnrnrnI understand this to be because of the use of `fread`: https://github.com/symfony/console/blob/master/Helper/QuestionHelper.php#L214.rnrnThe actual recorded value is correct, but the content put on the command line is not.rnrnRemoving the auto complete resolves the problem, but obviously then removes the auto complete functionality.rnrn**How to reproduce** rnI believe this is a minimal test case:rnrn```rnclass QuestionAsker extends Commandrn{rn protected function configure()rn {rn $this->setName('app:question-asker');rn }rnrn protected function execute(InputInterface $input, OutputInterface $output)rn {rn $helper = $this->getHelper('question');rnrn $question = new Question('Enter something multi byte:');rn $question->setAutocompleterValues(rn ['a', 'b', 'c']rn );rnrn // Write out the current content so it's easier to editrn //$output->write($currentContent);rn $data = $helper->ask($input, $output, $question);rnrn $output->writeln('This is incorrect ^');rn $output->writeln('This data is correct:');rn $output->writeln($data);rn }rn}rn```rnrn**Possible Solution** rnI'm not sure ud83dude1e rnrn**Additional context** rnWe did this on a Mac, running either Terminal or ITerm2 (same output in both cases).rn

issue.title: [Cache] Improve some error messages
issue.body: **Description**  rnWhen I run some commands that make use of the cache, I get this:rnrn```bashrn$ ./bin/console app:some-commandrnrn10:45:08 WARNING [cache] Failed to save key '... some key ...' (array)rn['key' => '... some key ...', 'type' => 'array', 'exception' => null]rn['log_uuid' => 'cf01082a-0f5f-4b36-86e9-3b5a5ee6832a']rn```rnrnNo additional info is provided on `dev.log` either, so this is tricky to debug. Thanks to @nicolas-grekas this was restricted to either a serialization problem of the cached content or the use of APCu-based cache. In this case it wasn't a serialization issue because the content was a simple array.rnrnLet's check if we can add more error messages (or improve the existing ones) to explain the error in more detail and provide, if possible, solutions to fix them. Thanks!

issue.title: process object to get lastOutputTime
issue.body: **Description**  rnI run watch webpack build by symfony process,but when i can not check if is building before wait.so ,i should a public method in process class to get lastOutputTime to check it.rnrn**Example**  rn```rn$this->runner($params, $messages, true,function(Process $process,$progressBar){rn                $process->setTimeout(null);rn                $process->start();rn                $process->wait(function ($type, $buffer) use($progressBar) {rn                    if (microtime(true) - $process->getLastOutputTime() > 10){rn                        $this->output->writeln('<fg=yellow>start to watch</>');rn                    }rn                });rn            });rn```

issue.title: NormalizerInterface type mismatch between supportsNormalization and normalize
issue.body: **Symfony version(s) affected**: 4.1.0rnrn**Description**  rnNormalizerInterface has two methods: `supportsNormalization` which accepts a value of any type and `normalize` which accepts only objects. In case `supportsNormalization` returns `true` for a non-object value the same value will be passed to `normalize` thus violating the interface.rnrn**How to reproduce**  rn```phprn$normalizer = new class implements SymfonyComponentSerializerNormalizerNormalizerInterface {rnrn    /**rn     * {@inheritdoc}rn     */rn    public function normalize($object, $format = null, array $context = array())rn    {rn        // @see https://github.com/symfony/serializer/blob/079905bcd7/Normalizer/NormalizerInterface.php#L28rn        // As per docs `$data` is `object`.rn        assert(is_object($object), 'Value of type `' . gettype($object) . '` received where object expected.');rn        return serialize($object);rn    }rnrn    /**rn     * {@inheritdoc}rn     */rn    public function supportsNormalization($data, $format = null)rn    {rn        // @see https://github.com/symfony/serializer/blob/079905bcd7/Normalizer/NormalizerInterface.php#L44rn        // As per docs `$data` is `mixed`.rn        // Returning `true` here for a non-object valuern        // will cause a non-object value to be passed to `::normalize`.rn        return true;rn    }rnrn};rnrn$serializer = new SymfonyComponentSerializerSerializer(rn  [$normalizer],rn  [new SymfonyComponentSerializerEncoderJsonEncoder()]rn);rnrn// @see https://github.com/symfony/serializer/blob/079905bcd7/SerializerInterface.php#L24rn$serializer->serialize(['foo'], 'json');rn```rnrn**Possible Solution**  rnMaybe make the Serializer assume that all non-object values are not supported for normalization?rnrn**Additional context**rnFound using https://gitlab.com/phlint/phlint while using the Serializer in another project.rnrn```rn  u2716 Argument Compatibility: $data in vendor/symfony/serializer/Serializer.php:133rn    Argument #1 passed in the expression `$normalizer->normalize($data, $format, $context)` is of type `array`.rn    A value of type `array` is not implicitly convertible to type `object`.rn      Trace #1:rn        #1: Method `public function normalize(string[] $data, 'json' $format, array $context)`rn          specialized for the expression `$this->normalize($data, $format, $context)`rn          in `vendor/symfony/serializer/Serializer.php:106`.rn        #2: Method `public final function serialize(string[] $data, 'json' $format, array $context)`rn          specialized for the expression `$serializer->serialize(['foo'], 'json')`rn          in `sample.php:39`.rn    Rule documentation: https://gitlab.com/phlint/phlint/blob/master/documentation/rule/argumentCompatibility.mdrn```

issue.title: [phpunit-bridge] DeprecationErrorHandler doesn't catch deprecation triggered by SymfonyTestListenerTrait
issue.body: PHPUnit 6.5.7, Symfony 3.4 via Drupal 8.5.0rnrnTesting deprecation messages locally, I keep getting 'Legacy deprecation notices (6)' instead of the expected 'Remaining deprecation notices (6)' followed by the actual notices.rnrnJumping into DeprecationErrorHandler, I have found that the problem is here:rn```rnif (isset($trace[$i]['object']) || isset($trace[$i]['class'])) {rn                if (isset($trace[$i]['class']) && in_array($trace[$i]['class'], array('SymfonyBridgePhpUnitSymfonyTestsListener', 'SymfonyBridgePhpUnitLegacySymfonyTestsListener'), true)) {rn```rnThe second IF parses the message, but it's never triggered.  If I replace the condition with TRUE, I get the expected behavior. The condition fails because $trace[$i]['class'] on my machine points to SymfonyBridgePhpUnitLegacySymfonyTestsListenerForV6, not the aliased version.rnrndebug_backtrace() seems to always return unaliased classes, so how is the condition expected to work? What am I missing?

issue.title: Cache key 'email@address' contains reserved characters {}()/@:
issue.body: | Q                | Arn| ---------------- | -----rn| Bug report?      | maybern| Feature request? | norn| BC Break report? | norn| RFC?             | norn| Symfony version  | 3.4.4rnrn<!--rn- Please fill in this template according to your issue.rn- For support request or how-tos, visit https://symfony.com/supportrn- Otherwise, replace this comment by the description of your issue.rn-->rnHi,rnrnI have problem when submitting user form. I use FOSUserBundle and there's simple form with only two fields:rn`->add('name', TextType::class, [rn'label' => 'name and surname',rn])`rn`->add('department', TextType::class, [rn'label' => 'department',rn])`rnrnIt's also standard in controller:rn`$editForm = $this->createForm('CompanyAdminBundleFormUserEditType', $user);`rn`$editForm->handleRequest($request);`rnrnWhen I submit form **in production** env I get error in prod.log:rn`[2018-02-26 08:50:35] request.CRITICAL: Uncaught PHP Exception SymfonyComponentCacheExceptionInvalidArgumentException: 'Cache key 'email@address' contains reserved characters {}()/@:' at /Users/local/Sites/projectname/vendor/symfony/cache/CacheItem.php line 162 {'exception':'[object] (SymfonyComponentCacheExceptionInvalidArgumentException(code: 0): Cache key 'email@address' contains reserved characters {}()/@: at /Users/local/Sites/projectname/vendor/symfony/cache/CacheItem.php:162)'} []`rnrnAs far as I can check, the problem occurs on `handleRequest($request)` in controller and later on Symfony `Form` class when dispatches `POST_SUBMIT`rn`$dispatcher->dispatch(FormEvents::POST_SUBMIT, $event);`rnand then in `ValidationListener` class when runningrn`$violations = $this->validator->validate($form);`rnrnI do not use any custom cache bundles / vendors and it's first time I have such problem. Just don't know why. I understand error itself, that there's problem with '`@`' character in cache and with PSR-6, but have no idea what to check or change.rnrnThank you for help.

issue.title: Autowiring fails with normalizers in no debug mode
issue.body: | Q                | Arn| ---------------- | -----rn| Bug report?      | yesrn| Feature request? | norn| BC Break report? | norn| RFC?             | norn| Symfony version  | 3.3.9rnrnI'm using the autowiring for my services and i have some normalizers extending the ObjectNormalizer/AbstractNormalizer of the Serializer component.rnEverything works fine in the dev env with debug mode, but in the prod env and no debug the serialization groups that were defined in annotations are simply ignored.rnThe cause is that the [FrameworkExtension](https://github.com/symfony/symfony/blob/3.3/src/Symfony/Bundle/FrameworkBundle/DependencyInjection/FrameworkExtension.php#L1370) decorates the [ClassMetadataFactory](https://github.com/symfony/symfony/blob/3.3/src/Symfony/Component/Serializer/Mapping/Factory/ClassMetadataFactory.php) service with the [CacheClassMetadataFactory](https://github.com/symfony/symfony/blob/3.3/src/Symfony/Component/Serializer/Mapping/Factory/CacheClassMetadataFactory.php) service when debug mode is disabled. Therefore the ClassMetadataFactoryInterface type becomes ambiguous in the [AbstractNormalizer](https://github.com/symfony/symfony/blob/3.3/src/Symfony/Component/Serializer/Normalizer/AbstractNormalizer.php#L76) because of these two services implementing the same interface and because no alias is defined.rnI think it could be tricky to figure out, for most of developers, that an alias should be defined to resolve this problem.rnIMO this should be done in the FrameworkExtension, it would be an easy pick.rnrnping @nicolas-grekas

issue.title: [FrameworkBundle] assets:install does not clean unnecessary bundle folders
issue.body: | Q                | Arn| ---------------- | -----rn| Bug report?      | yesrn| Feature request? | norn| BC Break report? | norn| RFC?             | norn| Symfony version  | allrnrnIf you installed assets previously, and then a bundle removed its `Resources/public` (or you removed the bundle entirely), the corresponding bundle folder in `web/bundles` is not cleaned when running `assets:install` again.rnGetting a clean `web/bundles` folder requires deleting the folder and running the install again.rnrnNote that you even end up with broken symlinks in `web/bundles` in case assets were symlinked rather than copied.rnrnOriginally reported as https://github.com/symfony/flex/issues/22 for a case impacting the removal of a bundle.rnSee https://github.com/symfony/symfony-demo/pull/588 for such a case about removing public assets from existing bundles too (we missed at least 2 removals in the history, as the `sensiodistribution` folder was unused since before the demo switched to symlinks, while `framework` was after).rn

issue.title: [DI] YamlFileLoader unclear exception message when file can not be found
issue.body: | Q                | Arn| ---------------- | -----rn| Bug report?      | norn| Feature request? | yesrn| BC Break report? | norn| RFC?             | norn| Symfony version  | 2.8.0rnrnhttps://github.com/symfony/symfony/blob/v2.8.0/src/Symfony/Component/DependencyInjection/Loader/YamlFileLoader.php#L347rnrnWhen a file does not exist in the file system the exception message 'The service file '%s' is not valid.' implies that the file contains invalid yml while I think changing it to 'The service file '%s' does not exist.' would be a lot more clear for the user.rnrnIf others agree I would be happy to create a PR for this minor change.

issue.title: Remove some class parameters related to Routing
issue.body: | Q                | Arn| ---------------- | -----rn| Bug report?      | yes?rn| Feature request? | norn| BC Break report? | norn| Symfony version  | 3.xrnrnIn the `@FrameworkBundle/Resources/config/routing.xml` we define some parameters related to Routing classes. They don't follow the exact `[...].class` naming syntax used by Symfony in the past, but they look the same:rnrn```xmlrn<parameter key='router.options.generator_class'>SymfonyComponentRoutingGeneratorUrlGenerator</parameter>rn<parameter key='router.options.generator_base_class'>SymfonyComponentRoutingGeneratorUrlGenerator</parameter>rn<parameter key='router.options.generator_dumper_class'>SymfonyComponentRoutingGeneratorDumperPhpGeneratorDumper</parameter>rn<parameter key='router.options.matcher_class'>SymfonyBundleFrameworkBundleRoutingRedirectableUrlMatcher</parameter>rn<parameter key='router.options.matcher_base_class'>SymfonyBundleFrameworkBundleRoutingRedirectableUrlMatcher</parameter>rn<parameter key='router.options.matcher_dumper_class'>SymfonyComponentRoutingMatcherDumperPhpMatcherDumper</parameter>rn<parameter key='router.options.matcher.cache_class'>%router.cache_class_prefix%UrlMatcher</parameter>rn<parameter key='router.options.generator.cache_class'>%router.cache_class_prefix%UrlGenerator</parameter>rn```rnrnShouldn't we remove these parameters as we did with every other `.class` param?

issue.title: Rename DebugAccessDecisionManager to TraceableAccessDecisionManager
issue.body: | Q                | Arn| ---------------- | -----rn| Bug report?      | norn| Feature request? | norn| BC Break report? | norn| RFC?             | norn| Symfony version  | 3.3rnrnA while ago we introduced `DebugAccessDecisionManager` to collect this information and display it in the Security panel of the Symfony Profiler. I though that `Debug + ...` was a better name than `Traceable + ...`. However, every comparable class in Symfony is called `Traceable + ...`, so we should rename `DebugAccessDecisionManager` to `TraceableAccessDecisionManager`.rnrnThis issue is an 'easy pick', so it can be solved by any developer wanting to make their first contribution to Symfony. But first, let's wait and see if the Symfony Core members agree with this proposal.rn

issue.title: [serializer] Extra attributes may throw exception when denormalize
issue.body: During the denormalization of an object, the [AbstractObjectNormalizer](https://github.com/symfony/serializer/blob/master/Normalizer/AbstractObjectNormalizer.php#L186) do not throw exception when an attribute is not in allowed. As a result I can denormalize an array to an object with not mapped attributes.nnI'm currently designing an API.nUsers are not allowed to send extra attributes that are not mapped to my class.nI want to throw an exception on this case.nnIs it possible to implement this feature inside the Serializer component ?n

issue.title: How access to form.parent when the form has child called parent?
issue.body: How can know if a form has a parent or not, in a view?nnThe fast answer is:nn``` twign{{ form.parent }}n```nnbut if the form has a child called `parent` the above statement always return a result, even when they do not have a real parent.nnthen the only way to know if has a real parent is something like:nn``` twign{% set hasParent = (form.parent is not null and (not form.offsetExists('parent') or form.parent != form.offsetGet('parent'))) %}n```nnI'm missing something? nna method `hasParent()` is needed in the FormView to avoid the ArrayAccess.n

issue.title: [Form][2.8] Improve upgrade guide for deprecated form type instance usage
issue.body: Hey,nnwith 2.8 deprecating parsing `FormType` instances to the form builder, it'd be great to give users a hint how they can replace form types with constructor parameters.nnBefore:nn```n$someVar = new SomeVar('acme');n$form = $this->createForm(new MyType($someVar), $entity);n```nnAfter:nn```n$form = $this->createForm(MyType::class. $entity, ['someVar' => $someVar]);n```nnAnd in MyType:nn```npublic function configureOptions(OptionsResolver $resolver)n{n    $resolver->setRequired(['someVar']);n    $resolver->setAllowedType('someVar', 'AppBundleSomeVar'); n}n```nnI've used this in a couple of procjects as it always was a neat way to streamline form handling and [I'm not alone](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/34027711/passing-data-to-buildform-in-symfony-2-8-3-0).nnCheersnMatthiasn

issue.title: PropertyAccessDecorator should not accept callable strings
issue.body: Right now, PropertyAccessDecorator [treats callable strings as callables, not as strings](https://github.com/symfony/symfony/blob/master/src/Symfony/Component/Form/ChoiceList/Factory/PropertyAccessDecorator.php#L87). Consequently the following code does not behave as expected:nn``` phpn$builder->add('deadline', ChoiceType::class, [n    'choices' => $dateRanges, // DateRange objectsn    'choice_label' => 'end',n]);n```nnThis code results in a fatal error. The `end()` function exists (is callable), hence the string is not treated as property path. Instead, `end()` is called with invalid arguments. IMO there are very few cases where this would be the expected behavior, and even if, it could be solved by passing a closure:nn``` phpn$builder->add('deadline', ChoiceType::class, [n    'choices' => $dateRanges, // arrays of datesn    'choice_label' => function (array $dateRange) {n        return end($dateRange);n    },n]);n```nnTreating callable strings as callables should be deprecated. I.e., all methods of PropertyAccessDecorator should trigger deprecation errors `if (is_string($value) && is_callable($value))`.n

issue.title: [3.0][Form] Entity construct linked to a form 'prototype' does not work
issue.body: Hello guys,nnI'm a question that is probably a bug of the framework.nnI have two forms: 'ReservaType' and 'HospedeType'. nnThe form 'ReservaType' has a collection(CollectionType field) of 'HospedeType', 'HospedeType' is a form linked a entity 'Hospede' and entity 'Hospede' has the __construct method, which inserts the default values for each field.nnThe problem I found is related to calling this method. The 'prototype' of 'HospedeType'(in 'ReservaType') does not call '__construct' method, which in turn does not load default values, including other entities linked to 'Hospede'.nn**Example field with prototype:**nn``` phpn// ...n            ->add('hospedes', CollectionType::class, [n                'label' => 'admin.label.hospedes',n                'entry_type' => HospedeType::class,n                'entry_options' => [n                    'required' => true,n                ],n                'allow_add' => true,n                'allow_delete' => true,n                'by_reference' => falsen            ])n// ...n```nn**Example 'Hospede' entity construct:**nn``` phpn// ...n    public function __construct()n    {n        parent::__construct();n        $this->pessoaFisica = new Fisica();n        $this->chegadaPrevista = new DateTime();n        $this->partidaPrevista = (new DateTime())->add(new DateInterval('P1D'));n        $this->principal = false;n        $this->vip = false;n        $this->fichaNacional = new FichaNacional($this);n        $this->disparouEmailBoasVindas = false;n        $this->disparouEmailCheckIn = false;n        $this->status = 1;n    }n// ...n```nnHospedeType configureOptionsnn``` phpn    // ...n    public function configureOptions(OptionsResolver $resolver)n    {n        $resolver->setDefaults([n            'data_class' => 'CoreBundleEntityHospede',n            'cascade_validation' => truen        ]);n    }n   // ...n```nnThis is a bug?nnTksn

issue.title: Allow to define Enum nodes with one element
issue.body: In #15433 we partially solved this limitation. But, [as reported](https://github.com/symfony/symfony/pull/15433#issuecomment-183228331) by @ogizanagi, we also need to change EnumNodeDefinition: https://github.com/symfony/symfony/blob/master/src/Symfony/Component/Config/Definition/Builder/EnumNodeDefinition.php#L34-L36n

issue.title: [Form] Deprecate Traversable support in ResizeFormListener::preSubmit()
issue.body: Right now, `ResizeFormListener::preSubmit()` accepts both arrays and Traversables as data. This does not make much sense since data sent by the browser always comes as arrays.nnSupport for Traversables should be deprecated and removed in 4.0 in order to facilitate fixes like https://github.com/symfony/symfony/pull/13116.n

issue.title: [Validator] Remove necessity to set constraint_validator alias
issue.body: Right now, when adding a constraint validator to the DI configuration, you need to do:nn``` yamlnservices:n    my_validator:n        class: AcmeConstraintsMyValidatorn        tags:n            - { name: validator.constraint_validator, alias: AcmeConstraintsMyValidator }n```nnIt should not be necessary to pass that alias, but right now it is.n

issue.title: Improve ConstraintValidator#buildViolation() documentation
issue.body: In [`UPGRADE-3.0.md`](https://github.com/symfony/symfony/blame/master/UPGRADE-3.0.md#L1187), it is advised to use `buildViolation()` instead of `addViolationAt()`, however as a part of Pull-Request #12016, this method was also marked as depreciated.nnWhat is the preferred way to handle this situation?n

issue.title: Adding HTTP_HOST in SymfonyBundleFrameworkBundleClient for insulated requests
issue.body: I am using insulated requests for my unit testing, but the SERVER variable did not come through:nn``` phpn    $this->client = $this->createClient(array(), array('HTTP_HOST' => 'my.local.host'));n    $this->client->followRedirects(false);n    $this->client->insulate(true);n```nnI found out that I can fix this issue in SymfonyBundleFrameworkBundleClient::getScript() by addingnn``` phpn    $_SERVER['HTTP_HOST'] = '{$this->getServerParameter('HTTP_HOST')}';n```nnin the code.Maybe it can be done better!n

issue.title: [Config] FileResource vs DirectoryResource inconsistent

issue.title: Missing removal of deprecated classes in UPGRADE-3.0.md

issue.title: Change the default value of framework.session.cookie_httponly
issue.body: Actually, the default value of `framework.session.cookie_httponly` is `false`, which allows javascript to read the sessionId.nnTo improve security, I think, we should add a BC Break by inverting this parameter.n

issue.title: Use random_bytes() in Symfony
issue.body: As of PHP 7.0, `random_bytes` 'generates cryptographically secure pseudo-random bytes'. We are doing something similar in `SymfonyCoreComponentSecurityUtilSecureRandom::nextBytes()` as we should probably use the build-in function for PHP7.nnAlso, @paragonie-scott maintains paragonie/random_compat, a compat lib for PHP 5.x, which we can use for non-PHP7 installations.nnping @symfony/deciders n

issue.title: [Security] Using 0 as username
issue.body: UserAuthenticationProvider not allow username '0'nnhttps://github.com/symfony/symfony/blob/master/src/Symfony/Component/Security/Core/Authentication/Provider/UserAuthenticationProvider.php#L65n

issue.title: [Form] Deprecate 'choices_as_values' => false
issue.body: The value `false` for the 'choices_as_values' option (= the current default value) should be deprecated in 2.8. This means that people need to manually set the option to `true` for all choice fields.nnIn Symfony 3.0, we can remove the code for handling the value `false` and deprecate the 'choices_as_values' option altogether. In a future 3.x release, the option can be removed to complete the transition.n

issue.title: [Yaml] usage of conditional @deprecated-tag in Yaml::parse
issue.body: Yaml::parse features a 'conditional' `@deprecated` tag; the text after the tag explains that only the feature to supply filepaths is deprecated and will be removed in v3.0. PHPStorm however doesn't know this and marks the method as deprecated by striking through every call to it:n![yamlparse](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5630275/7913892/8ab2f8da-0873-11e5-9a24-95738d091e47.png)nnI know it is a good habit to mark stuff that will be removed as `@deprecated`, but I think in this case the `@deprecated` tag is a bit overkill since it also 'deprecates' valid method calls. What are your thoughts on this?n

issue.title: [DX] Minor improvement for the translation:debug output
issue.body: Currently, `translation:debug` output uses a legend to show the state of each translation. Example:nn```n+----------+----------------------------------------+------------------------------------------+n| State(s) | Id                                     | Message Preview (en)                     |n+----------+----------------------------------------+------------------------------------------+n| o        | what.is.component                      | What is a Component?                     |n| =        | the.components                         | The Components                           |n| o        | browserkit.summary                     | Simulates the behavior of a web browser. |n| x        | browserkit.description                 |                                          |n| o        | classloader.summary                    | Loads your project classes automatica... |n| x        | classloader.description                |                                          |n| ...                                                                                          |n+----------+----------------------------------------+------------------------------------------+nnLegend:n x Missing messagen o Unused messagen = Same as the fallback messagen```nnI find the legend confusing when the table is very long, which is usually the case. Moreover, the `State` column is wide enough to not use a legend and just display the labels.nnThat's why I propose to change this table a bit to look as follows:nn```n+----------+----------------------------------------+------------------------------------------+n| State    | Id                                     | Message Preview (en)                     |n+----------+----------------------------------------+------------------------------------------+n| unused   | what.is.component                      | What is a Component?                     |n| same     | the.components                         | The Components                           |n| unused   | browserkit.summary                     | Simulates the behavior of a web browser. |n| missing  | browserkit.description                 |                                          |n| unused   | classloader.summary                    | Loads your project classes automatica... |n| missing  | classloader.description                |                                          |n| ...                                                                                          |n+----------+----------------------------------------+------------------------------------------+n```n

issue.title: [DX] [TwigBundle] Allow to configure date and number formats
issue.body: ## The problemnnWhen using Twig as a standalone project, you can define the date and number format as follows:nn``` phpn$twig = new Twig_Environment($loader);n$twig->getExtension('core')->setDateFormat('d/m/Y', '%d days');n```nnWhen using Twig inside a Symfony application, you have to use code like this to define this setting:nn``` phpn$this->get('twig')->getExtension('core')->setDateFormat('d/m/Y', '%d days');n```nnEven worse, some people recommend to create [a request listener to set this setting](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/9886058/how-can-i-set-the-default-date-format-for-twig-templates-in-symfony2).nnIn my opinion, having to create a listener, adding ugly code to my controllers and hurting application performance just to set the number or date format for my Twig templates is wrong.n## The solutionnnTwigBundle should expose two new configuration options called `number_format` and `date_format` to simply configure these settings.n

issue.title: symfony 2 profiler bar throws javascript error in IE8
issue.body: In IE8 and 9 the symfony 2 profiler throws a javascript error caused by the ajax requests logged.nnIE8 and 9 do not have  have a addEventListener object in XMLHttpRequest, but use attachEvent instead.nnFor IE8 and 9, in base_js.html.twig instead of `this.addEventListener('readystatechange', function() {`nit should be `this.attachEvent('onreadystatechange', function () {`n

issue.title: [Config] Race condition and filemtime
issue.body: Hello, Symfony team!nnI want to discuss the behaviour of Config component with checking of file modification time. Currently cache is considered as fresh only when the filemtime of cache is **greater** than the filemtime of resource.nnHowever, I noticed that for small applications on nice hardware resource creation time and cache creation time can be within one second, so Config component will think that the cache is stale, but this is wrong. nnI want to propose to add an additional `strictFilemtimeCheck` flag for the constructors of resources which will be true by default. When this flag is false, then the check will be not strict and will include an equal sign. Then, developers will be able to decide what to do when filemtime is equal: consider this as stale/fresh cache.n

issue.title: [security] Base ACL exceptions on the RuntimeException
issue.body: All the [ACL exceptions](https://github.com/symfony/symfony/blob/master/src/Symfony/Component/Security/Acl/Exception/Exception.php) are based on the generic `Exception` class. This is only done in a three different components (CSS, Config and the Security ACL). nnI would suggest a change to `RuntimeException`, as this is a more detailed exception, giving users the opportunity to deal with the exceptions in a cleaner way (easier distinguish between runtime and logic exceptions for one) and to be more consistent with the rest of the exceptions defined in Symfony, which all rely on the SPL exceptions.nnIt can break backward compatibility when exception handling is done on both `RuntimeException` and `Exception`, and not on any of the ACL exceptions directly, although I doubt this will ever be the case.n

issue.title: The MimeTypeGuesser::guess() exception message is misleading
issue.body: Some users in Drupal had the following exception message:nn```n'Unable to guess the mime type as no guessers are available (Did you enable the php_fileinfo extension?)'n```nnSadly this is not the entire truth, there are two of them by default.nn```n        if (FileBinaryMimeTypeGuesser::isSupported()) {n            $this->register(new FileBinaryMimeTypeGuesser());n        }nn        if (FileinfoMimeTypeGuesser::isSupported()) {n            $this->register(new FileinfoMimeTypeGuesser());n        }n```nnThe actual error message should take into account both.n

issue.title: Add references from the API doc to the documentation on symfony.com

issue.title: [CS] Remove aligned '=>'
issue.body: I would like to remove all aligned `=>` symbols from our code base and add a corresponding rule to our coding conventions:nnBefore:nn``` phpn$resolver->setDefaults(array(n    'data_class'            => $dataClass,n    'empty_data'            => $emptyData,n    'trim'                  => true,n    'required'              => true,n    'read_only'             => false,n    // ... snip ...n    'action'                => '',n    'attr'                  => $defaultAttr,n    'post_max_size_message' => 'The uploaded file was too large. Please try to upload a smaller file.',n));n```nnAfter:nn``` phpn$resolver->setDefaults(array(n    'data_class' => $dataClass,n    'empty_data' => $emptyData,n    'trim' => true,n    'required' => true,n    'read_only' => false,n    // ... snip ...n    'action' => '',n    'attr' => $defaultAttr,n    'post_max_size_message' => 'The uploaded file was too large. Please try to upload a smaller file.',n));n```nnAlthough the first version looks nicer, it is:n- more difficult to maintain, because whole arrays have to be adjusted when the length of the longest key changes;n- more difficult to review PRs, since their diffs contain lines which are unrelated to the PR apart from whitespace changes;n- and most importantly, very difficult to use `git blame`. If you want to find out when/why 'read_only' was set to `false`. You will have to follow a chain of commits that only changed whitespace (and use `git blame` on those commits again) before you find the commit that actually changed the line.n

issue.title: [DX] Show a message if server:start is missing pcntl
issue.body: Hi guys!nnWe now have the `server:start` and `server:stop` commands, but they require the `pcntl` extension. If this extension is not available, the `isEnabled()` function return false, so the commands are completely not available.nnI think this may cause 'wtf' moments for users - especially if they're following docs that say to use `server:start`. Instead, I'd propose:nn1) Removing the `pctnl` check from `isEnabled`n2) Checking for `pcntl` inside `execute()` and returning a very clear message if it is missing:nn> This command needs the `pcntl` extension to run. You can either install this, or use the `server:run` command instead to run the built-in web server.nnOr alternatively we could actually say:nn> This command needs the `pctnl` extension to run. Since this extension is not installed, we'll instead start the built-in web server using the `server:run` commandnn... and then we would actually call the `server:run` command for them.nnAlso, why not print a message at the bottom of `server:run` that says:nn> Quick the server with CONTROL+C.nnI've 'borrowed' the language even from Django (https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/1.7/intro/tutorial01/#the-development-server), so there is some precedence for that :).nnping @xabbuhn

issue.title: [DX] improve file loader errors for router

Make sure the 'AcmeDemoBundle' bundle is correctly registered and loaded in the application kernel class.n```nnThe bundle was correctly created and registered. Didn't had a look at the code yet but I think it can be easy to add this check and improve the error message.nnWhat do you think?n

issue.title: [DX] Improve bad controller class error

The current error looks like this:nn![screen shot 2014-07-04 at 7 58 25 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/121003/3485461/81f26f6c-03df-11e4-83a5-ad95de38b801.png)nnThe `FooBundle:Course2` is a bit confusing, because I don't recognize that from anywhere (I typed `FooBundle:Course2:index`). I'd like to improve this error, perhaps:nn> The _controller value 'FooBundle:Course2:index' maps to a 'KnpFooBundleControllerCourse2Controller' class, but this class was not found. Create this class or check the spelling of the class and its namespace.n

issue.title: XLIFF source-language / target-language
issue.body: Running translation:update creates XLIFF files with the target language in the 'source-language' attribute instead of the 'target-language' attribute.nne.g:nn``` bashn~$ console translation:update --force --output-format=xlf fr SomeBundlen```nngives:nn``` xmln <file source-language='fr' ... >n```nninstead of:nn``` xmln<file source-language='en' target-language='fr' ... >n```nnwhere 'en' would be the default language in the Symfony config.nnThis may not pose a problem for the Symfony translation component, but it makes the files less portable.n

issue.title: [DomCrawler] using double quotes in selectButton
issue.body: Symfony 2.5.0 is usednnWhen string with double quotes is passed into `selectButton` it is not escaped properly and produces wrong xpath.nn`selectButton('Click 'Like'')` produces this XPathnn```n  descendant-or-self::input[((contains(translate(@type, 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ', 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'), 'submit') or contains(translate(@type, 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ', 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'), 'button')) and contains(concat(' ', normalize-space(string(@value)), ' '), ' click 'Like' ')) or (contains(translate(@type, 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ', 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'), 'image') and contains(concat(' ', normalize-space(string(@alt)), ' '), ' click 'Like' ')) or @id='click 'Like'' or @name='click 'Like''] | descendant-or-self::button[contains(concat(' ', normalize-space(string(.)), ' '), ' click 'Like' ') or @id='click 'Like'' or @name='click 'Like'']nn```nnPossible issue:nn```nsprintf('| descendant-or-self::button[contains(concat(' ', normalize-space(string(.)), ' '), %s) or @id='%s' or @name='%s']', static::xpathLiteral(' '.$value.' '), $value, $value);n```nnis not escaping $value as literal to be xpath compatible.n

issue.title: [Validator] Support 'maxSize' given in KiB
issue.body: The `File` constraint should support the following notations for the 'maxSize' option:nn``` phpnnew File(array('maxSize' => 1234)); // bytesnnew File(array('maxSize' => '2k')); // kilobytes (case insensitive)nnew File(array('maxSize' => '2ki')); // kibibytes (case insensitive)nnew File(array('maxSize' => '1m')); // megabytes (case insensitive)nnew File(array('maxSize' => '1mi')); // mebibytes (case insensitive)nn// etc.n```nnThe conversion of the passed value to the number of bytes should be done already in the constructor of `File`, to simplify dealing with the file constraint:nn``` phpn$constraint = new File(array('maxSize' => '1ki'));nnassert 1024 === $constraint->maxSize;n```n

It would be helpfull if there were comments describing how the methods should be implemented and how the are used.nnhttp://symfony.com/doc/2.3/cookbook/security/custom_authentication_provider.htmlnis describing the Interface a bit, but especially the signature of the create method is unclear.n

issue.title: [Form] Deprecate 'read_only' option
