issue.title: Incorrect validation for maxSize option in the FileValidator
issue.body: u0421urrent implementation for [Symfony/Component/Validator/Constraints/FileValidator.php](https://github.com/symfony/symfony/blob/master/src/Symfony/Component/Validator/Constraints/FileValidator.php):nn```n    // ...n    } elseif (preg_match('/^d++k$/', $constraint->maxSize)) {n        $size = round(filesize($path) / 1000, 2);n        $limit = (int) $constraint->maxSize;n        $suffix = 'kB';n    } elseif (preg_match('/^d++M$/', $constraint->maxSize)) {n        $size = round(filesize($path) / 1000000, 2);n        $limit = (int) $constraint->maxSize;n        $suffix = 'MB';n    } else {n    // ...n```nnWe try upload file with size of 4 034 560 bytes (maxSize is set 4M).nIt equals 3940 Kb and 3.8477 Mb.nnValidation says: `The file is too large (4.03 Mb). Allowed maximum size is 4 MB.`nnSo, I think we should have following implementation for correct calculation:n- for Kb `$size = round(filesize($path) / 1024, 2);`n- for Mb `$size = round(filesize($path) / 1048576, 2);`n

issue.title: Swiftmailer memory spool send on kernel.terminate prevents the profiler from working
issue.body: Precondition: Swiftmailer configured with invalid smtp credentials (e.g. an incorrect password), and set up to use the memory spool.nnWhen I load a route that sends an email, the web profiler toolbar does not appear, the response header for the page contains `X-Debug-Token: 12345`however when I load `/_profiler/12345` I get the following message.nn> Token not foundnnIf I switch to the file spool, and try and send the resulting message from the page, I get a `Swift_TransportException` as expected:nn> [Swift_TransportException]n> Failed to authenticate on SMTP server with username 'username@email.com' using 1 possible authenticatorsnnMy assumption is that somehow during `kernel.terminate` this exception being raised is blocking the profiler component from collecting/completing its collection of data and persisting it (to sqlite?).nn(I using Symfony version 2.4.2.)n

issue.title: Yaml parse fails to understand or allow %YAML
issue.body: Directly from the docs at http://www.yaml.org/spec/1.2/spec.html#id2781553n **A version 1.2 YAML processor _must_ accept documents with an explicit u201c%YAML 1.2u201d directive, as well as documents lacking a u201cYAMLu201d directive.**nnexample yaml file:nn``` yamln%YAML 1.2nn---nyapeal:n    application_agent: ''n    registered_mode: 'optional'n```nnUsing:nn``` phpn$handler = new Yaml();n$result = $handler->parse($yapealYaml);nvar_dump($result);nprint PHP_EOL;n```nnExpect:nn```nArrayn(n    [yapeal] => Arrayn        (n            [application_agent] =>n            [registered_mode] => optionaln)nn```nnGet:nn```nNULLn```nnIf I use %YAML 1.1 also get the same result. This is also covered in the above spec about how it should be handled.n

issue.title: [HttpFoundation] Add a way to match a specific scheme in RequestMatcher
issue.body: I've come across the need to match the scheme of a request for a security firewall and ended up with this class. I was wondering if it should be merged into the core. WDYT ?nnThe code is inspired by `SymfonyComponentHttpFoundationRequestMatcher::matchMethod()`.nn```n<?phpnnnamespace SymfonyExtensionComponentHttpFoundation;nnuse SymfonyComponentHttpFoundationRequest as BaseRequest;nuse SymfonyComponentHttpFoundationRequestMatcher as BaseRequestMatcher;nn/**n * This class improves Symfony2's RequestMatcher by adding a method to specify the scheme(s) to match.n */nclass RequestMatcher extends BaseRequestMatchern{n    /** @var string[] */n    protected $schemes;nn    /**n     * Adds a check for the HTTP scheme.n     *n     * @param string|string[]|null $scheme An HTTP scheme or an array of HTTP schemesn     */n    public function matchScheme($scheme)n    {n        $this->schemes = array_map('strtolower', (array) $scheme);n    }nn    /**n     * {@inheritDoc}n     */n    public function matches(BaseRequest $request)n    {n        if ($this->schemes && !in_array($request->getScheme(), $this->schemes)) {n            return false;n        }nn        return parent::matches($request);n    }n}n```n

issue.title: [Translation] Xliff: Support for Notes
issue.body: The XLIFF standard supports the `notes` tag, in which notes can be passed along to the translator and is supported by translation systems our there, like OneSky.nnAdding notes to existing files does not break symfony in any way, however running the automated translation update command does. It basically ignores the field so the new files do not have notes anymore.nnI'm imagining that doing this may imply in changing the message catalogue to support extra information, but there may be other ways to achieve the result.nnI would like to know how feasible it is, what solutions people can see, before attempting to do it. Or if anyone has found a separate solution they can share.n

issue.title: app/console list finds a namespace ambiguous if it only consists of sub-namespaces
issue.body: If, for example, a project consists of the following commands:nn```nmy-website:admin:do-somethingnmy-website:admin:do-something-elsenmy-website:data:blahnmy-website:data:blah-blahn```nncalling `app/console list my-website` causes an exception:nn```n The namespace 'my-website' is ambiguous (my-website:admin, my-website:data).n```nnThis does not look like what would be expected. Adding a command into `my-website`  namespace directly (e.g. `my-website:test`) helps to avoid the issue u2013 command listing starts working fine.nnPerhaps, the problem is in [SymfonyComponentConsoleApplication::getNamespaces()](https://github.com/symfony/symfony/blob/master/src/Symfony/Component/Console/Application.php#L473) u2013 this method registers only one namespace per command, so parent namespaces remain unknown unless they contain any commands directly.n

issue.title: Response:: isNotModified returns false when If-Modified-Since is later than Last-Modified
issue.body: In [the `isNotModified` method of `HTTPFoundationResponse`](https://github.com/symfony/symfony/blob/master/src/Symfony/Component/HttpFoundation/Response.php#L1099), there is an equality check between the If-Modified-Since request header and the Last-Modified response header, which only returns true if the dates are identical. Ideally it should also return true when the Last-Modified date is earlier than the If-Modified-Since date, as the response has not been modified since the If-Modified-Since date.nn[RFC 2616](http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html#sec14.25) mentions that this can happen:nn> Note: When handling an If-Modified-Since header field, some servers will use an exact date comparison function, rather than a less-than function, for deciding whether to send a 304 (Not Modified) response. To get best results when sending an If-Modified-Since header field for cache validation, clients are advised to use the exact date string received in a previous Last-Modified header field whenever possible.nnThe [Django project has discussed and fixed this issue](https://code.djangoproject.com/ticket/717) in the past.n

issue.title: [Serializer] Constructor parameters handled incorrectly when denormalizing in GetSetMethodNormalizer
issue.body: When trying to denormalize an object (from JSON, but this is not relevant) using the 'constructor way', the parameter order can be incorrect under certain conditions.nnFor example if I use a constructor like thisnn``` phpnpublic function __construct($foo, $bar = array(), $baz = array())n```nnand use the following data for denormalizationnn``` phpnarray('foo' => 'test', 'baz' => array(1, 2, 3))n```nnI'd expect the constructor to be called like thisnn``` phpnnew MyClass('test', array(), array(1, 2, 3))n```nnbut this is what happens in realitynn``` phpnnew MyClass('test', array(1, 2, 3))n```nnso the value that is 'baz' is used for 'bar', which is really unpleasant.nnI'm only starting my 'life with Symfony' and don't have the time to read on the docs and make a proper pull request now, so I hope anybody else could do that. This bug is present ever since Symphony 2.0.n

issue.title: Cache-Control header contains 'no-cache' despite other caching headers set
issue.body: Documentation says:nn> If no cache header is defined (Cache-Control, Expires, ETag or Last-Modified), Cache-Control is set to no-cache, meaning that the response will not be cached;nnAccording to above, this action:nn``` phpn    public function testAction()n    {n        $resp = new Response();n        $resp->setLastModified(new DateTime('-1 day'));n        $resp->setPublic();n        $resp->setSharedMaxAge(999);n        $resp->setContent('test response header cache-control');n        return $resp;n    }n```nnshould result with Content-Control header 'max-age=0, s-maxage=999', but the actual header is 'max-age=0, no-cache, s-maxage=999'.n

issue.title: Set External Parameters using PHP Built-In Server
issue.body: Hello,nnI have found an issue with setting parameters externally (as explained on the '[How to Set External Parameters in the Service Container](http://symfony.com/doc/current/cookbook/configuration/external_parameters.html)' page) using PHP 5.4's built-in server.nnIf you refer to [this StackOverflow question](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/13784116/setting-environment-variables-with-the-built-in-php-web-server) and [this GitHub issue](https://github.com/symfony/symfony/issues/9298), you can see that the variables-order INI directive must be set to include 'E' so that you can set environment variables like so:nn```nexport SYMFONY__DATABASE__PASSWORD='password'nphp -d variables_order=EGPCS -S 0.0.0.0:8080 -t . test.phpn```nnThis works fine, and `SYMFONY__DATABASE__PASSWORD` can be accessed via `getenv('SYMFONY__DATABASE__PASSWORD')` and `$_ENV['SYMFONY__DATABASE__PASSWORD']`. nnThe problem is,n- Setting env variables through Nginx will set them in `$_ENV` and `$_SERVER`n- Setting env variables through the built-in server will set them in `$_ENV` but _not_ in `$_SERVER`nnThe [variables-order INI directive documentation](http://us.php.net/manual/en/ini.core.php#ini.variables-order) contains the following warning:nn```n'In both the CGI and FastCGI SAPIs, $_SERVER is also populated bynvalues from the environment; S is always equivalent to ES regardlessnof the placement of E elsewhere in this directive.'n```nnThe Symfony HttpKernel will only load the environment variables if they exist in $_SERVER, and not if they exist in $_ENV.nSee [the getEnvParameters() method in src/Symfony/Component/HttpKernel/Kernel.php](https://github.com/symfony/symfony/blob/master/src/Symfony/Component/HttpKernel/Kernel.php#L609).nnIf $_ENV was included in this method, I believe this would resolve the issue.nIf there is an alternative solution, please let me know! :)nnCheers,nRyann

issue.title: DomCrawlerForm doesn't handle image inputs properly
issue.body: When a `DomCrawlerForm` is initialized with an `<input type='image' name='bar'>` element, it will end up in `$form->getValues()` as 'bar', instead of 'bar.x' and 'bar.y'. Because of this, there is no way to set the values for the x and y coordinates and it will incorrectly miss those variables in the GET/POST data, would the form be submitted.nnRan into this issue while using fabpot/Goutte, where my submitted form did not get picked up properly by the receiving webserver, because the 'imageinputname'.x and 'imageinputname'.y were not present in the POST data.n

issue.title: [Security] AccessDecisionManager decide function behaviour
issue.body: In the current AccessDecisionManager the behaviour between the decide methods decideAffirmative() and decideUnanimous() vary.nnSo if you use the affirmative strategy for example access is granted through the RoleVoter if the user has at least one of the specified roles. If you use the unanimous strategy the access is denied through the RoleVoter if the current user has not all of the specified roles. So the same Voter grants different access for the two strategies.nnThe different behavior derives from the different usage of the Voter attributes in the two decide-methods. The decideUnanimous() methods gives, through the additional foreach-loop for the attributes (line 189), all attributes separate to the Voters contrary to the decideAffirmative() method which gives all attributes at once to the Voters.nnAccording to the documentation http://symfony.com/doc/current/components/security/authorization.html one would expect the strategy to influence only how the voter results are combined, not how each voter works on its own.nnWe discovered this weird behaviour using the Secure-Annotation from the JMSSecurityExtraBundle.nnConsidering the following codenn```nuse JMSSecurityExtraBundleAnnotationSecure;nn/**n* @Secure(roles='ROLE_A, ROLE_B')n*/npublic function exampleAction()n{n```nnThe unanimous-strategy allows access for the user only if he has both of the roles (A and B), while the affirmative-strategy grants access even if the user has only one of the roles (A or B).n

issue.title: [Form] Support passing EntityManager instances in 'em' option
issue.body: Hi,nnWe are trying to replace a 'entity' field by changing only options in an event subscriber.nnSo basically what we do is:nn``` phpn$form->add(n    $field->getName(),n    $field->getConfig()->getType()->getName(),n    array_merge($field->getConfig()->getOptions(), array('disabled' => true))n);n```nnThe problem is that it seems the `->getOptions()` returns the normalized options and not the original ones. Thus the `em` option is normalized and `em` is not a string anymore but the concrete entity manager.nnThis is problematic because then the `DoctrineType` throws an exception because it only deals with strings or null values:nn```n// SymfonyBridgeDoctrineFormTypeDoctrineType;n$emNormalizer = function (Options $options, $em) use ($registry) {n            /* @var ManagerRegistry $registry */n            if (null !== $em) {n                return $registry->getManager($em); // This is where the exception is thrownn            }n            // ...n```nnI think that the code below should probably fix the problem:nn``` phpn// SymfonyBridgeDoctrineFormTypeDoctrineType;n$emNormalizer = function (Options $options, $em) use ($registry) {n            /* @var ManagerRegistry $registry */n            if (null !== $em) {n                if (is_object($em)) {n                    return $em;n                }n                return $registry->getManager($em);n            }n            // ...n```nnWhat is your opinion?n

issue.title: The twig:lint command does not detect some compile-time issues
issue.body: Twig forbids using a positional argument after a named argument. This check is done at compile time but `twig:lint` does not detect it, because it does not try to compile the AST, and so does not validate rules enforced by the compiler rather than the parser.n

issue.title: ExtensionValidatorUtilServerParams uses $_SERVER instead of Request Handler
issue.body: SymfonyComponentFormExtensionValidatorUtilServerParams directly calls to $_SERVER rather than use the set request handler (such as HttpFoundationRequestHandler).nnThis causes an issue of compatibility with phpBB because we disable direct calls to $_SERVER to help prevent less experienced programmers from writing extensions which could open their software to security vulnerabilities.n

issue.title: CardSchemeValidator - Separate logic
issue.body: It would be great if the logic within the CardSchemeValidator was re-usable. I would be able to complete this. However, I am not quite sure the best place to move this (or if this is something that would be accepted)nn``` phpn<?phpnnnamespace VivoPaymentBundleUtil;nnclass CardSchemen{n    const SCHEME_AMEX = 'amex';n    const SCHEME_CHINA_UNIONPAY = 'china_unionpay';n    const SCHEME_DINERS = 'diners';n    const SCHEME_DISCOVER = 'discover';n    const SCHEME_INSTAPAYMENT = 'instapayment';n    const SCHEME_JCB = 'jcb';n    const SCHEME_LASER = 'laser';n    const SCHEME_MAESTRO = 'maestro';n    const SCHEME_MASTERCARD = 'mastercard';n    const SCHEME_VISA = 'visa';nn    private static $schemes = array(n        /**n         * American Express card numbers start with 34 or 37 and have 15 digits.n         */n        self::SCHEME_AMEX => array(n            '/^3[47][0-9]{13}$/'n        ),n        /**n         * China UnionPay cards start with 62 and have between 16 and 19 digits.n         * Please note that these cards do not follow Luhn Algorithm as a checksum.n         */n        self::SCHEME_CHINA_UNIONPAY => array(n            '/^62[0-9]{14,17}$/'n        ),n        /**n         * Diners Club card numbers begin with 300 through 305, 36 or 38. All have 14 digits.n         * There are Diners Club cards that begin with 5 and have 16 digits.n         * These are a joint venture between Diners Club and MasterCard, and should be processed like a MasterCard.n         */n        self::SCHEME_DINERS => array(n            '/^3(?:0[0-5]|[68][0-9])[0-9]{11}$/',n        ),n        /**n         * Discover card numbers begin with 6011, 622126 through 622925, 644 through 649 or 65.n         * All have 16 digitsn         */n        self::SCHEME_DISCOVER => array(n            '/^6011[0-9]{12}$/',n            '/^64[4-9][0-9]{13}$/',n            '/^65[0-9]{14}$/',n            '/^622(12[6-9]|1[3-9][0-9]|[2-8][0-9][0-9]|91[0-9]|92[0-5])[0-9]{10}$/'n        ),n        /**n         * InstaPayment cards begin with 637 through 639 and have 16 digitsn         */n        self::SCHEME_INSTAPAYMENT => array(n            '/^63[7-9][0-9]{13}$/'n        ),n        /**n         * JCB cards beginning with 2131 or 1800 have 15 digits.n         * JCB cards beginning with 35 have 16 digits.n         */n        self::SCHEME_JCB => array(n            '/^(?:2131|1800|35[0-9]{3})[0-9]{11}$/'n        ),n        /**n         * Laser cards begin with either 6304, 6706, 6709 or 6771 and have between 16 and 19 digitsn         */n        self::SCHEME_LASER => array(n            '/^(6304|670[69]|6771)[0-9]{12,15}$/'n        ),n        /**n         * Maestro cards begin with either 5018, 5020, 5038, 5893, 6304, 6759, 6761, 6762, 6763 or 0604n         * They have between 12 and 19 digitsn         */n        self::SCHEME_MAESTRO => array(n            '/^(5018|5020|5038|6304|6759|6761|676[23]|0604)[0-9]{8,15}$/'n        ),n        /**n         * All MasterCard numbers start with the numbers 51 through 55. All have 16 digits.n         */n        self::SCHEME_MASTERCARD => array(n            '/^5[1-5][0-9]{14}$/'n        ),n        /**n         * All Visa card numbers start with a 4. New cards have 16 digits. Old cards have 13.n         */n        self::SCHEME_VISA => array(n            '/^4([0-9]{12}|[0-9]{15})$/'n        ),n    );nn    /**n     * @param string $cardNumbern     * @return null|stringn     */n    public static function getSchemeFromNumber($cardNumber)n    {n        if (null === $cardNumber || '' === $cardNumber || !is_numeric($cardNumber)) {n            return null;n        }nn        foreach (self::$schemes as $scheme => $regexes) {n            foreach ($regexes as $regex) {n                if (preg_match($regex, $cardNumber)) {n                    return $scheme;n                }n            }n        }nn        return null;n    }nn    /**n     * @param string $schemen     * @return stringn     */n    public static function getSchemeName($scheme)n    {n        switch ($scheme) {n            case self::SCHEME_AMEX:n                return 'American Express';nn            case self::SCHEME_CHINA_UNIONPAY:n                return 'China UnionPay';nn            case self::SCHEME_DINERS:n                return 'Diners Club';nn            case self::SCHEME_DISCOVER:n                return 'Discover';nn            case self::SCHEME_INSTAPAYMENT:n                return 'InstaPayment';nn            case self::SCHEME_JCB:n                return 'JCB';nn            case self::SCHEME_LASER:n                return 'Laser';nn            case self::SCHEME_MAESTRO:n                return 'Maestro';nn            case self::SCHEME_MASTERCARD:n                return 'MasterCard';nn            case self::SCHEME_VISA:n                return 'Visa';n        }nn        return 'Unknown';n    }n}n```nnI think the only difference in my class and the Symfony class would be to change the method to getSchemsFromNumber and return an array of the matching schemes.n

issue.title: [NETBEANS SUPPORT BREAK] Detection of interactive shell fails
issue.body: This issue was originally reported in NetBeans Bugzilla, see [1].nnThe problem is that Symfony now detects wheher the shell is interactive or not - and this detection fails when one runs a Symfony command directly in NetBeans. This used to work in previous versions of Symfony so it is a regression (from NetBeans' point of view). Moreover, there is no way to force interactive shell so unfortunately we are not able to fix/work around it rigth now.nnProposed solution:nIf an env variable (e.g. `SHELL_INTERACTIVE=true`) is set, the interactive shell will be forced. Or, of course, a new option could be added but in such case, it would be kind of backward compatibility break since NetBeans would not work with older Symfony versions (with the env variable, this problem would not occur).nnThanks.n[1] https://netbeans.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=239750n

issue.title: The error handling is inconsistent in the serializer decoders
issue.body: Here is what happens currently:n- the ChainDecoder throws a `SymfonyComponentSerializerExceptionRuntimeException` when it cannot find a decoder for the format (and then an exception thown by the decoder being used)n- the XmlEncoder throws a `SymfonyComponentSerializerExceptionUnexpectedValueException` on failuren- the JsonDecode and JsonEncoder fail silently (you get `null` as value) and then provide a method to get the json decoding error code (not the same name in them btw), which is not part of the interface (making the method hard to use as we don't have any way to access it when it is used in the serializer)n- the Serializer just proxies the call to its ChainDecoder so the behavior is the same.nnBoth exceptions used here implement the exception interface of the component.nnMy suggestion is to refactor the json decoder classes to make them throw the UnexpectedValueException on failure like the xml format instead of using a separate method which cannot be accessed.nThe phpdoc of the interface should also be updated to document the expected behavior on failure, which is currently not specifiedn

issue.title: The Config YamlReferenceDumper should rely on the Yaml component escaper

issue.title: Always trust 127.0.0.1 as a proxy
issue.body: The remote address in a fragment sub-request is always set to `127.0.0.1` and the original remote address is pushed into the `X-FORWARDED_FOR` header. This is the expected behavior implemented by @fabpot in 2f3b33a630727cbc9cf21262817240a72a8dae0c and explained for the `HttpCache` component [here](https://github.com/symfony/symfony/issues/7765#issuecomment-19388776).nnBut when retrieving the client IP via `Request::getClientIp()`, one will now always get `127.0.0.1` when it's not added as a trusted proxy. This seems strange, as it will most likely be incorrect and might confuse users which now have to mangle with configuring a trusted proxy, even though they don't actually have a real proxy in place.nnAlso in the commit message of 2f3b33a630727cbc9cf21262817240a72a8dae0c it says:nn> also making getClientIp smarter by removing possible local IP addresses from being considered as the client IP addressnnBut no according change is part of that commit, `getClientIp` does actually consider 127.0.0.1 as the client IP.n

issue.title: Misleading error message for validator service pointing to wrong class
issue.body: In Symfony 2.3.4, vaguely following the instructions from http://symfony.com/doc/master/cookbook/validation/custom_constraint.html#constraint-validators-with-dependencies, I've declared a constraint validator service like this:nn``` xmln<service id='...' class='FullyQualifiedConstraintClassName'>n  <argument type='service' id='...' />n  <tag name='validator.constraint_validator' alias='...' />n</service>n```nnYou may notice my mistake: I've set the class attribute value to the constraint class instead of the validator class. Unfortunately, Symfony gave me the misleading error message: 'No default option is configured for constraint'. nnMaybe one can provide a better error message by inferring from the tag name=validator.constraint_validator that the class in the class attribute has to extend SymfonyComponentValidatorConstraintValidator?n

issue.title: RedirectController::redirect() loses querystring parameters
issue.body: While RedirectController::urlRedirect() preserves the querystring parameters and passes them on to the redirected request, RedirectController::redirect() will lose them.nnExpectation:nn```nindex_redirect:                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             n     path: /index.php                                                            n     defaults:                                                                   n         _controller: FrameworkBundle:Redirect:redirect                          n         route: home                                           n         permanent: truenother_redirect:                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             n     path: /foo.php                                                            n     defaults:                                                                   n         _controller: FrameworkBundle:Redirect:urlRedirect                          n         path: /bar                                           n         permanent: truenn```nnI would expect both of these to do the same thing, but the first one takes the route name. However, only the second route will preserve the querystring parameters on the request. The first one will drop them.n

issue.title: [Translation] Add default %_count% parameter to transChoice
issue.body:
Currently there is no way to retrieve the number argument for `transchoice`. When using a filter this becomes complicated:nn``` djangon{% set ticketsSold = ad.ticketsSold | length %}n{% transchoice ticketsSold %}n {1} You have sold 1 ticket| [2,Inf] You have sold %ticketsSold% ticketsn{% endtranschoice %}
n```nnWhy not create an extra internal variable (like `loop` inside for loops in Twig):nn``` djangon{% transchoice ad.ticketsSold | length %}n {1} You have sold 1 ticket| [2,Inf] You have sold %_count% ticketsn{% endtranschoice %}
n```nnHere, %_count% refers to the number argument for transchoice. nnIt would be very easy to do this by adding the following code to [Translator::transChoice](https://github.com/symfony/symfony/blob/master/src/Symfony/Component/Translation/Translator.php#L196):nn``` phpn$parameters['%_count%'] = $number;n```nnShould I submit a PR?n

issue.title: BrowserKit CookieJar is totally ignorant of RFC 6265 edge cases
issue.body: The `BrowserKit/CookieJar` code [uses exact domain and path matches](https://github.com/symfony/BrowserKit/blob/master/CookieJar.php#L58) to store and retrieve cookies:nn`$this->cookieJar[$domain][$path][$name]`nnThis utterly fails the [requirements of RFC 6265 for matching domains](http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6265#section-4.1.2.3):nn> For example, if the value of the Domain attribute is 'example.com', the user agent will include the cookie in the Cookie header when making HTTP requests to example.com, www.example.com, and www.corp.example.com.nnIf you load any google resource you'll receive a cookie with `domain=.google.com`. According to the RFC this cookie should match any domain ending in .google.com as well as google.com itself.nnSimilar problems exist with path matching where leading and trailing slashes figure in to whether or not a cookie matches what's stored in the `CookieJar`. From [the relevant RFC section](http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6265#section-4.1.2.4):nn> The user agent will include the cookie in an HTTP request only if the path portion of the request-uri matches (or is a subdirectory of) the cookie's Path attribute, where the %x2F ('/') character is interpreted as a directory separator.nnExact path matches aren't sufficient -- subdirectory paths should also be matched.n

issue.title: php.ini 'post_max_size = 0' clash with form validator
issue.body: If in the php.ini 'post_max_size' is set to 0, there is no limitation in the post size:n[from php.ini]n; Maximum size of POST data that PHP will accept.n; Its value may be 0 to disable the limit. It is ignored if POST data readingn; is disabled through enable_post_data_reading.n; http://php.net/post-max-sizenpost_max_size = 0nnHowever, in this case, the validator (tested via Form) trigger alwaysn'The uploaded file was too large. Please try to upload a smaller file.'nn[Fix]nEnable the control only if post_max_size > 0n

issue.title: BrowserKit recursive redirect
issue.body: If a redirect-header is returned by a request of some url and the redirect-url is just the same as the requested url (thus its a recursive redirect) then the BrowserKit client will follow the recursive tree until the php maximum function nesting level, which by default is 100.nnBrowserKit should have a configurable (?) maximum for following redirects and the ->request() call should return nicely (at least with a clean exception?) if it reaches the maximum.n

issue.title: [HttpFoundation] allow database Session Handlers to be extended
issue.body: If there's additional actions to be done on on session events (additional cleanup on destroy/gc, or additional logging on other events, it would be nice to be able to extend the `PdoSessionHandler` and `MongoDbSessionHandler` classes. However, both have their database connections set to `private`.nnI can think of two ways of accomplishing this: either setting those connectors to `protected`, so child objects can access them, or to add an additional `getConnection()` method, to provide read-only access to those connectors. More complex would be to add some sort of event system such that the session handlers broadcast to other listeners when a session event happens.nnIs there a better way to accomplish doing other tasks when a session event happens?n

issue.title: [DomCrawler] need for submitting invalid choice values
issue.body: It seems to be not possible to submit an invalid value for a choice field in a form using BrowserKit's Client. This is prevented by https://github.com/symfony/symfony/blob/v2.1.9/src/Symfony/Component/DomCrawler/Field/ChoiceFormField.php#L140, which doesn't make sense when writing integration tests, as I'd like to see the expected form validation errors.nnWhat's the purpose of those checks and, if they are needed, how can they be disabled for tests?n

issue.title: XmlUtils::phpize floats integer-lists
issue.body: I'm trying to let my config accept:nn```n<node attribute='1234,5678,9101,1121,3141' />n```nnto parse the this attribute as a string. But the SymfonyComponentConfigUtilXmlUtils::phpize-Method (previously SimpleXMLElement::phpize) replaces this to float(1.2345678910111E+19).nnThis is caused by the preg_match-case.n

issue.title: [HttpKernel] Improve TraceableEventDispatcher to not call Stopwatch::stop() when not started
issue.body: Currently, in TraceableEventDispatcher:385, Stopwatch::stop() is called even when the Stopwatch was not started:nn``` phpncase KernelEvents::RESPONSE:n    // stop only if a controller has been executedn    try {n        $this->stopwatch->stop('controller');n    } catch (LogicException $e) {n    }n    break;n```nnThe result is that on every request, an exception will be thrown and caught (consequently this is not an 'exceptional' case anymore). Another consequence is that debuggers will halt and show this exception (again, on every request).nnAn improvement would be to add a Stopwatch::isStarted() method and use it instead:nn``` phpncase KernelEvents::RESPONSE:n    // stop only if a controller has been executedn    if ($this->stopwatch->isStarted('controller')) {n        $this->stopwatch->stop('controller');n    }n    break;n```n

issue.title: Login Redirect Does not Honor Query String Parameters
issue.body: When a user successfully logs in, the user is redirected to the page he originally was trying to view via the onAuthenticationSuccess() function in  https://github.com/symfony/symfony/blob/master/src/Symfony/Component/Security/Http/Authentication/DefaultAuthenticationSuccessHandler.php.nnI am using a javascript history state library to keep track of my javascript frontend state and it generates urls such as `/my/site#foo=bar&more=links`.nnWhen I am redirected from the login page, all the query string parameters after the url `#foo=bar&more=links` are not preserved. Could this possibly be fixed in future versions or is there a good reason not to honor the states of these types of requests?n

issue.title: [Routing] Cannot specify port for route with hostname
issue.body: By default the router uses the port of the current request when linking to an external site and there's no way to override it.nnFor example, an application that runs on port 8888, when generating a url from a route such as below, will generate the url '//example.com:8888/article/view/{id}'.nn``` ymlnmy_route:n    pattern: /article/view/{id}n    hostname: example.comn```nnAlso, if you try to specify a port number in the hostname, e.g.nn```nmy_routen    pattern: /article/view/{id}n    hostname: example.com:80n```nnIt will generate a url similar to '//example.com:80:8888/article/view/{id}'.nnMy first thought would be to introduce a 'port' parameter, which can be used to specify the port, and if it's not provided fall back to the port for the current request?nnWe only use the hostname parameter to generate url's for an external site which we need to link to, so I'm not sure how this works in regards to matching a route.n

issue.title: XML and Yaml format doesn't work with Optional/Required collection constraints
issue.body: Assume we have this entity:nn``` phpnclass Authorn{n    /**n     * @AssertCollection(fields={n     *     'alternate_email' = @Optional({@AssertEmail})n     * })n    public $profileData = array();n}n```nnThe annotations and PHP format is working as expected. However, the Yaml and Xml format isn't working. On the documentation, we (ryan, @afishnamedsquish and I) have put some time in trying to get a working Yaml and Xml format, but it seems like it's not possible.nnIf we have this:nn``` yamlnAcmeAuthorBundleEntityAuthor:n    properties:n        profileData:n             - Collection:n                fields:n                    alternate_email:n                        - CollectionOptional:n                            - Email: ~n```nnWe get this error:nn> Fatal error: Class 'SymfonyComponentValidatorConstraintsCollectionOptionalValidator'nnIt's going wrong in [`Collection` line 50](https://github.com/symfony/Validator/blob/2.1/Constraints/Collection.php#L50-52):nn``` phpnif (!$field instanceof Optional && !$field instanceof Required) {n    $this->fields[$fieldName] = $field = new Required($field);n}n```nn`$field` is an instance of Optional or Required when using PHP or annotations. When using Yaml, `$field` is an array:nn```narray (size=1)n  0 => n    object(SymfonyComponentValidatorConstraintsCollectionOptional)[4300]n      public 'constraints' => n        array (size=1)n          0 => n            object(SymfonyComponentValidatorConstraintsEmail)[4301]n              ...n      public 'groups' => n        array (size=1)n          0 => string 'Default' (length=7)n```nnBecause it's not an instance of Optional or Required, it becomes:nn```nobject(SymfonyComponentValidatorConstraintsCollectionRequired)[4302]n  public 'constraints' => n    array (size=1)n      0 => n        object(SymfonyComponentValidatorConstraintsCollectionOptional)[4300]n          public 'constraints' => n            array (size=1)n              ...n          public 'groups' => n            array (size=1)n              ...n  public 'groups' => n    array (size=1)n      0 => string 'Default' (length=7)n```nnAnd that's when we are in trouble, because the `ValidatorFactory` will search for `OptionalValidator`.nnI have tried every Yaml syntax I know to make `$field` a class and not an array, but I can't find it. I think some change in the `YamlFileLoader` is needed to make these edge cases work.nnThis is the same for Xml:nn``` xmln<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8' ?>n<constraint-mapping xmlns='http://symfony.com/schema/dic/constraint-mapping'n    xmlns:xsi='http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance'n    xsi:schemaLocation='http://symfony.com/schema/dic/constraint-mapping http://symfony.com/schema/dic/constraint-mapping/constraint-mapping-1.0.xsd'>nn    <class name='AcmeAuthorBundleEntityAuthor'>n        <property name='profileData'>n            <constraint name='Collection'>n                <option name='fields'>n                    <value key='alternate_email'>n                        <constraint name='CollectionOptional'>n                            <constraint name='Email' />n                        </constraint>n                    </value>n                </option>n            </constraint>n        </property>n    </class>n</constraint-mapping>n```nnIf you want some background on this issue, see symfony/symfony-docs#2432 and [this gist](https://gist.github.com/afishnamedsquish/5277987).n

issue.title: Bug with NamespacedAttributeBag in use with session
issue.body: Hi !nnI have set my application to use the NamespacedAttributeBag for sessions.nnI've observed the following behavior:nnIn my template, if I do this:nn```n{{dump(app.session.get('cart' , 0))}}n```nnIt dumps:nn```narray (size=1)n  1 => n    array (size=1)n      2 => n        array (size=1)n          8 => int 1n```nnThat is the expected behaviornnNow if I do:nn```n{{dump(app.session.get('cart/1/2' , 0))}}n```nnI get:nn```narray (size=1)n  8 => int 1n```nnThat's fine too.nnAnd finally, if I do this:nn```n{{dump(app.session.get('cart/1/1/2' , 0))}}n```nnI get:nn```narray (size=1)n   8 => int 1n```nnThat is not fine! I should get 0 or null. There is no array in cart['1']['1'] !nnIs that a bug ?n

issue.title: [ACL]Exceptions come up while initializing ACL tables in SQL Server 2008 DB
issue.body: While I am executing the ACL initializing command 'php app/console init:acl' to create the tables in SQL Server 2008 DB, it creates the tables with some exceptions which lead to not creating the relationships.nnThe exceptions are:nn[DoctrineDBALDBALException]nAn exception occurred while executing 'ALTER TABLE acl_object_identity_ancestors ADD CONSTRAINT FK_825DE299C671CEA1 FOREIGN KEY (ancestor_id) REFERENCES acl_object_identities (id) ON UPDATE CASCADE ON DELETE CASCADE':nnSQLSTATE[42000]: [Microsoft][SQL Server Native Client 11.0][SQL Server]Introducing FOREIGN KEY constraint 'FK_825DE299C671CEA1' on table 'acl_object_identity_ancestors' may cause cycles or multiple cascade paths. Specify ON DELETE NO ACTION or ON UPDATE NO ACTION, or modify other FOREIGN KEY constraints.nn[PDOException]nSQLSTATE[42000]: [Microsoft][SQL Server Native Client 11.0][SQL Server]Introducing FOREIGN KEY constraint 'FK_825DE299C671CEA1' on table 'acl_object_identity_ancestors' may cause cycles or multiple cascade paths. Specify ON DELETE NO ACTION or ON UPDATE NO ACTION, or modify other FOREIGN KEY constraints.n

issue.title: [Console] DialogHelper::ask() while loop issue with 0
issue.body: The while loop in `SymfonyComponentConsoleHelperDialogHelper::ask()` terminates, when you enter a 0. `fread` gets the 0 and assigns it to `$c` and then the loop breaks. As we all know PHP interpretes a 0 as false.nnI tried to fix it and came up with the following idea using `ord()` and `chr()`:nn``` phpn...nwhile ($c = ord(fread($inputStream, 1))) {n    $c = chr($c);n...n```nnIt solves the problem but I find it rather ugly. nnDoes anyone have a better idea about this?n

issue.title: [Feature Request] Use absolute url's for standalone error/exception pages

issue.title: SymfonyComponentDomCrawlerCrawler::addContent() - handling of MIME types
issue.body: If the server responds with an empty HTTP Content-Type, 'text/html' is assumed, which is good.  However, if the Content-Type contains a charset but no MIME type, e.g. 'charset=utf-8' or '; charset=utf-8', the method returns null and the DOM is not parsed.nnDesired behaviour is that a Content-Type with a charset but no MIME type should be treated in the same way as an empty Content-Type, with regards to the default 'text/html' MIME being assumed.  This is the way my browser responds to such a Content-Type when there is HTML in the response body.nnThis was relevant to me because of a bug in ZF2 and the Content-Type headers it returns under certain circumstances, and the use of the Symfony DomCrawler component in the Behat integration testing/BDD tool.  I will pursue the Zend bug separately.n

issue.title: [Service Container] Container camelize strange behavior
issue.body: At Container the method camelize:nn``` phpn    /**n     * Camelizes a string.n     *n     * @param string $id A string to camelizen     *n     * @return string The camelized stringn     */n    public static function camelize($id)n    {n        return preg_replace_callback('/(^|_|.)+(.)/', function ($match) { return ('.' === $match[1] ? '_' : '').strtoupper($match[2]); }, $id);n    }n```nnI don't understand why if the first char is . or _ is kept:nn``` phpnphp > function camelize($id) { return preg_replace_callback('/(^|_|.)+(.)/', function ($match) { return ('.' === $match[1] ? '_' : '').strtoupper($match[2]); }, $id); }nphp > echo camelize('test.test2') . 'n';nTest_Test2nphp > echo camelize('.testtest2') . 'n';n.testtest2nphp > echo camelize('test_test2') . 'n';nTestTest2nphp > echo camelize('_test_test2') . 'n';n_testTest2n```nnIf the camelize is used to transform for example an array on several variables it will fail:nn``` phpnphp > $.t = 5;nPHP Parse error:  syntax error, unexpected '.', expecting variable (T_VARIABLE) or '$' in php shell code on line 1nnParse error: syntax error, unexpected '.', expecting variable (T_VARIABLE) or '$' in php shell code on line 1n```nnAnd is really strange that after you camelize a string it still keep underscore. My suggestion is that if a _ or . exists as first character would disappear on camelize, so instead of the below behavior both would return TestDann``` phpnphp > echo camelize('test_da') . 'n';nTestDanphp > echo camelize('_test_da') . 'n';n_testDan```n

issue.title: [Process] Orphan temporary files are left on Windows
issue.body: On Windows `Process::start` creates a temporary file every time because of this code:nn``` phpn        if (defined('PHP_WINDOWS_VERSION_BUILD')) {n            $this->fileHandles = array(n                self::STDOUT => tmpfile(),n            );n```nnWhen being invoked for thousands of times as part of task scheduling pipeline, it leaves thousands of temporary files and eventually hits the limit at 65536 files per directory, after which point it can't create a new temporary file and simply dies.nnAfter being used, the temporary file should be deleted.n

issue.title: Form fields and buttons do not follow the ownership overwrite defined by form-attributes
issue.body:
I was redirected here from Goutte, on the issue of form fields with a 'form' attribute not getting correctly processed.nnThe gist of it is: the 'form' attribute (placed on fields and buttons and such) is an overwrite to the form ownership property of the element. This means that regardless of where the field (or button) is it should behave as-if it were inside the form identified by the ID defined by the value of the attribute. nnSome official docs:nhttp://dev.w3.org/html5/spec/single-page.html#attr-fae-formnnWith the exception of IE (10 included), all modern browsers support it fine. In the case of IE it's a simple javascript fixu2014just like every other normal html5 feature. For the case of tests and such it would be very useful for the standard behavior to work (especially when there's no real way to work around it).nnThe following is a basic behat test (assume Goutte driver), so as to avoid very wordy explanations on other points related to it.nn```n@environmentnFeature: test environment driversn In order perform tests successfullyn As a Developern Test drivers must conform to standardsnn Background:n Given I am on the test siten And I am on '/tests/form-attribute.php'nn Scenario: press button_1 of form_1 from inside of form_1n Given I press 'Capture fields'n Then I should see 'form_name is form_1'n And I should see '2 apples'n And I should see '0 oranges'n And I should see 'button_1 present'n And I should see 'button_2 not present'n And I should see 'button_3 not present'n And I should see 'outer_field present'nn Scenario: press button_3 of form_1 from inside of form_2n Given I press 'Submit from outside the form'n Then I should see 'form_name is form_1'n And I should see '2 apples'n And I should see '0 oranges'n And I should see 'button_1 not present'n And I should see 'button_2 not present'n And I should see 'button_3 present'n And I should see 'outer_field present'nn Scenario: press button_2 of form_2 from inside of form_1n Given I press 'Submit form_2'n Then I should see 'form_name is form_2'n And I should see '0 apples'n And I should see '3 oranges'n And I should see 'button_1 not present'n And I should see 'button_2 present'n And I should see 'button_3 not present'n And I should see 'outer_field not present'nn```nnWhere `/tests/form-attribute.php` is as follows...nn```nnnTest Casennnn
' method='POST'>n n n n n
nn nn
' method='POST'>n n n n n n n
nnnnn';n echo (isset($_POST['apples']) ? count($_POST['apples']) : 0).' apples
n';n echo (isset($_POST['oranges']) ? count($_POST['oranges']) : 0).' oranges
n';nn foreach (['button_1', 'button_2', 'button_3', 'outer_field'] as $key)n {n echo $key.' '.(isset($_POST[$key]) ? 'present' : 'not present').'
n';n }nn echo '
n';nn var_dump($_POST);n?>nnn```n

issue.title: BinaryFileResponse - hashing strategy
issue.body: Currently the hashing system in the new BinaryFileResponse has known limitations. It will be greatly beneficial if these are addressed by offering means to overcome these.nnhttps://github.com/symfony/symfony/commit/7322696378e96a812c78c1f23b80606b7fb06ac4#commitcomment-2193066nnAn option is to simplify the logic for hashing, by separating the hashing from the setting of the entity tag and from the file-input. This can be done simply by putting sha1_file() in a different method, that can be easily overridden, or by allowing a more OO approach by injecting the hashing strategy. The latter might be a bit more bulky but allows the most flexibility while maintaining clean separation of concerns.n

issue.title: Deprecated: IntlDateFormatter::setTimeZoneId():
issue.body: As i am playing with 5.5.0 alpha1 and a sf application i get this.nn```nDeprecated: IntlDateFormatter::setTimeZoneId(): Use datefmt_set_timezone() instead, which also accepts a plain time zone identifier and for which this function is now an alias in /Users/Henrik/Work/myapp/vendor/symfony/symfony/src/Symfony/Component/Form/Extension/Core/Type/DateType.php line 262n```n

issue.title: [Form] Improve default form error messages
issue.body: I think that in order to provide a better user experience, we should improve the error messages shipped with the Form component by default. I am **not** talking about the error messages in the Validator component.nnIf I use the Validator component stand-alone, getting an error such as 'This value is not a valid number' is fine. If I use the Form component, displaying that message for a form field is a bit awkward. Even worse are the tons of 'This value is invalid' messages.nnI suggest ton1. Set sensible defaults for the 'invalid_message' options in all core types. These defaults should be user friendly, such as 'Please enter a valid email address.' (or better, if you have suggestions)n2. Duplicate the error messages of the Validator component into the Form component and change the translations to be more user friendly (in the web form context, again, such as 'Please enter a valid number' or better). This will mean a bit more maintenance work, but much better UX.nnOpinions? How would you ideally like the error messages to be when you submit an erroneous field?n

issue.title: [Translation] XLIFF implementation broken by design
issue.body: We are having an issue with the way the xliff format is implemented inside symfony2. nThis was brought here before by @schmittjoh in #2252 but was closed down.nnI'm proposing to do a BC break here and change the XLIFF to a format where translation tools are actually useful. ne.g. Because we use keys as our translation source the tools like www.getlocalization.com show those keys as a source to be translated which according to the xliff specification is the right thing to do.nn``` xmln<trans-unit id='<id>' resname='<resname>'>n  <source>Original string</source>n  <target>Target language translation</target>n</trans-unit>n```nnWhere the < id > is somesort of unique id e.g hash of  < resname >, The < resname > is set to translation key or 'Original string' in case that translation is not based on the keys and the < source > tag contains the string in language the translations will be made from.n

issue.title: [Form] Rename 'empty_value' option to 'placeholder'
issue.body: See #4715 for reference.nnThe 'empty_value' option of ChoiceType (and consequentially EntityType) is used to configure the displayed values of the dropdowns when the field is empty. This is analogous to the 'placeholder' HTML5 attribute of other field types.nnI propose to deprecate 'empty_value' and add a new option 'placeholder' ton- ChoiceTypen- all types represented by input widgets that support this attributen

issue.title: [Console] [Windows] recuperation of the console height and width for non english OS
issue.body: [here](https://github.com/symfony/symfony/blob/master/src/Symfony/Component/Console/Application.php#L853) and [here](https://github.com/symfony/symfony/blob/master/src/Symfony/Component/Console/Application.php#L875), a `exec('mode CON')` is made in order to parse line and column number of the console from Windows command.nnThis only work on english Windows.nnFor example with french Windows: nn```n>php -r 'exec('MODE CON', $output);var_dump($output);'narray(9) {n  [0]=>  string(0) ''n  [1]=>  string(27) 'Statut du pu00e9riphu00e9rique CON:'n  [2]=>  string(27) '---------------------------'n  [3]=>  string(26) '    Lignesu00a0:          9999'n  [4]=>  string(24) '    Colonnesu00a0:        80'n  [5]=>  string(24) '    Vitesse clavieru00a0: 31'n  [6]=>  string(23) '    Du00e9lai clavieru00a0:   1'n  [7]=>  string(25) '    Page de codesu00a0:   437'n  [8]=>  string(0) ''n}n```nnCouldn't find yet a nice and universal way to do it yet. If anyone has an idea :)n

issue.title: [2.1][Security] Check_path and logout fails on non latin path
issue.body: RuntimeException: You must activate the logout in your security firewall configurationnnIn example:nn``` yamln# app/config/security.ymlnsecurity:n    firewalls:n        main:n            form_login:nn                # this is okn                login_path:  /u0432u0445u043eu0434 nn                # check_path failsn                check_path:  /u0430u0432u0442u043eu0440u0438u0437u0430u0446u0438u044fn            logout:n                # logout path failsn                path:   /u0432u044bu0445u043eu0434 n```nnAll this happens because of SymfonyComponentSecurityHttpHttpUtils::checkRequestPath request query string not url decodednn``` phpn    public function checkRequestPath(Request $request, $path)n    {n        if ('/' !== $path[0]) {n            try {n                $parameters = $this->urlMatcher->match($request->getPathInfo());nn                return $path === $parameters['_route'];n            } catch (MethodNotAllowedException $e) {n                return false;n            } catch (ResourceNotFoundException $e) {n                return false;n            }n        }nn        /**n        * var_dump($request->getPathInfo()) ;n        * var_dump($path);n        * ('/%d0%b2%d1%8b%d1%85%d0%be%d0%b4' === $request->getPathInfo()) truen        * ($path === urldecode($request->getPathInfo())) truen        */n        return $path === $request->getPathInfo();n    }n```n

issue.title: [Console] List available commands in the help command
issue.body: The help command should at least mention the list command (only if it's enabled though), or just simply list available commands when called on the top level `console --help` (not `console foo --help`). nnSee composer/composer#1143n

issue.title: [Form] Rethrow/log transformation exception
issue.body: If a Transformer throws a TransformationFailedException, the details of this exception are lost.nnhttps://github.com/symfony/symfony/blob/master/src/Symfony/Component/Form/Form.php line 592:nn``` phpn        } catch (TransformationFailedException $e) {n            $this->synchronized = false;n        }n```nnThe exception code+message should probably be kept and displayed.nnInstead, the error becomes 'This value is not valid.'. I've not been able to find out how, but this message occurs in:nhttps://github.com/symfony/symfony/blob/master/src/Symfony/Component/Form/Extension/Validator/Type/FormTypeValidatorExtension.phpnnRelated:nhttps://github.com/symfony/symfony/pull/4860nhttps://github.com/symfony/symfony/pull/703n

issue.title: JsonResponse can not be used to return an empty array
issue.body: I have a REST API that is used for retrieving a list of objects. From our perspective this API could quite legitimately return no matching results (ie an empty array).nnJsonResponse force converts an empty array to an ArrayObject which then gets output as an empty object giving us the wrong results on the client side. Nothing in the JSON spec mandates that the top level element can not be an empty array as such this looks like a bug in the Symfony JsonResponse object.nnThe offending code is viewable [here](https://github.com/symfony/symfony/blob/master/src/Symfony/Component/HttpFoundation/JsonResponse.php#L80). Fixing it should just be a matter of removing that if statement.n

issue.body: Nowadays i'm often getting Error's if I try to update translation-file like this:n  [Twig_Error_Runtime]  n  Attribute 'value' does not exist for Node 'Twig_Node_Expression_GetAttr'. nnIt seem's it come's from dynamic part of a transaltion. The Problem is, that it abort on the first twig error, it would be nice if the command run through and make what he can make. --ignore-expetionsnnOr just get in a prefix-viewfolder as argument:nn```n    $extractor->extract($foundBundle->getPath().'/Resources/views/'.$viewfolder, $catalogue);n```n

issue.title: [Translation] PoFileLoader should use stripcslashes instead of stripslashes
issue.body: `PoFileLoader::addMessage()` uses both `stripslashes` and `stripcslashes` to unescape translated strings, but `PoFileDumper` uses only `addcslashes` to escape strings. n- `PoFileLoader` should use only  `stripcslashes` to unescape strings (according with PoFileDumper, that generates correct PO files). n- `$item['ids']['singular']`  should be unescaped with `stripcslashes` (`msgid` are equivalent to `msgstr` strings).n

issue.body: Hey guys!nnCurrently, there's no standard way of retrieving the absolute URL to an asset. This would be useful when generating asset paths in a template for an email. Would be cool a function like:nn``` twign{{ asset_url('images/foo.jpg') }}n```nnThe current solution is not pratical and breaks when using CDN.nnThanks,nMarcosn

issue.title: the help of the command does not display global options
issue.body: Options available from the Application itself don't appear when displaying the help of a command by adding `--help`. Because of this, users need to be aware of the component implementation to know that more options may be available and that they need to call `app/console help` without specifying a command name to show them.nnI suggest adding a section `Global options` in the help output to show them too, keeping them isolated from command-specific options (btw, weren't they displayed in the list at some point ?)n

issue.title: ParameterBag's remove function only allows to remove one level deep
issue.body: If a parameter is an array it cannot remove elements inside the array, only the array itself. nFor instance I have the following request using the SonataMediaBundle:nn[common_mybundle_mytype] => array(n    [media] => array(n        [binaryContent] => nulln    ),n    [title] => 'Message title',n    [text] => 'Message textn)nnSay I want to remove the media only. With the current function I can only remove the full request. I have rewritten the function to the following:nn```nFile: SymfonyComponentHttpFoundationParameterBagnnpublic function remove($key)n{n    if(is_array($key))n    {n        $c = '$this->parameters';nn        foreach($key as $k)n        {n            $c .= '['' . $k . '']';n        }n        eval('unset($c);');n    }n    elsen    {n        unset($this->parameters[$key]);n    }n}n```n

issue.title: Wrong display in the timeline when 2 listeners have the same short class name
issue.body: When 2 listeners have the same short class name, the timeline display them in the same row (as if it was the same listener called twice) instead of using 2 rows.nnI saw it with AsseticBundle and NelmioApiDocBundle which have both a RequestListener (you may need to change the threshold to see them in the timeline as they are faster than 1ms)n

issue.title: onFlush events with 2 or more dbal connections throw ErrorExceptions
issue.body: In configuration's with 2 connections, onFlush events written to `(appDevDebugProject|appProd)Container.php` contain calls to addEventListener. The method signature for the 2nd connection is incorrect. Changing the order the connection's are specified produces the incorrect signature on whatever happens to be the 2nd connection.nnCompare the signatures for MysqlConnectionService and PlatConnectionService:nn`appDevDebugProjectContainer.php`nn``` phpnprotected function getDoctrine_Dbal_MysqlConnectionService()n{n    $c->addEventListener(array(0 => 'onFlush'), $this->get('nrc_notice.notice.notice_listener'));n}nnnprotected function getDoctrine_Dbal_PlatConnectionService()n{n    $c->addEventListener(array(0 => array(0 => 'onFlush')), $this->get('nrc_notice.notice.notice_listener'));n}n```nnError Messagenn``` textnErrorException: Warning: Illegal offset type in /Applications/MAMP/htdocs/checknet.local/vendor/symfony/symfony/src/Symfony/Bridge/Doctrine/ContainerAwareEventManager.php line 115nnin /Applications/MAMP/htdocs/checknet.local/vendor/symfony/symfony/src/Symfony/Bridge/Doctrine/ContainerAwareEventManager.php line 115nat ErrorHandler->handle('2', 'Illegal offset type', '/Applications/MAMP/htdocs/checknet.local/vendor/symfony/symfony/src/Symfony/Bridge/Doctrine/ContainerAwareEventManager.php', '115', array('events' => array(array('onFlush')), 'listener' => object(NoticeListener), 'hash' => '000000000bfa891500000000295a660c', 'event' => array('onFlush'))) in /Applications/MAMP/htdocs/checknet.local/vendor/symfony/symfony/src/Symfony/Bridge/Doctrine/ContainerAwareEventManager.php line 115nat ContainerAwareEventManager->addEventListener(array(array('onFlush')), object(NoticeListener)) in /Applications/MAMP/htdocs/checknet.local/app/cache/dev/appDevDebugProjectContainer.php line 272nat appDevDebugProjectContainer->getDoctrine_Dbal_PlatConnectionService() in /Applications/MAMP/htdocs/checknet.local/app/bootstrap.php.cache line 194nat Container->get('doctrine.dbal.plat_connection') in /Applications/MAMP/htdocs/checknet.local/app/cache/dev/appDevDebugProjectContainer.php line 370nat appDevDebugProjectContainer->getDoctrine_Orm_PlatEntityManagerService() in /Applications/MAMP/htdocs/checknet.local/app/bootstrap.php.cache line 194nat Container->get('doctrine.orm.plat_entity_manager') in /Applications/MAMP/htdocs/checknet.local/vendor/symfony/symfony/src/Symfony/Bridge/Doctrine/ManagerRegistry.php line 35n```nnMy `config.yml`nn``` ymlndoctrine:n    dbal:n        default_connection: mysqln        connections:n            mysql:n                 driver: etc...n            plat:n                 driver_class:   etc...n```nnMy `services.yml`nn``` ymlnservices:n  nrc_notice.notice.notice_listener:n     class: SomeListenerClassn     arguments:n       container: '@service_container'n     tags:n        - { name: kernel.event_listener, event: nrc_notice.notice.change.approved, method: onNotify }n```n

issue.title: HTTP/1.0 and caching
issue.body: Symfony sends `cache-control: no-cache` header by default. This make HTTP/1.1-compatible client and (correctly configured) reverse proxy not to cache the response. nBut if a client supports only HTTP/1.0 protocol, the `cache-control` header will be ignored. To prevent caching page in HTTP/1.0 protocol, Symfony should send also Expires or Pragma headers by default.n

issue.title: [Finder] Fix regexp detection in FileContentFilterIterator
issue.body: The iterator accepts both string and regexps, then there is a [test](https://github.com/symfony/symfony/blob/master/src/Symfony/Component/Finder/Iterator/FilecontentFilterIterator.php#L73) to detect regexps.nnThe test is flawed:n- http://fr2.php.net/manual/en/regexp.reference.delimiters.php: 'A delimiter can be any non-alphanumeric, non-backslash, non-whitespace character', delimiters could also be '{' and '}'n- http://fr2.php.net/manual/en/reference.pcre.pattern.modifiers.php: some modifiers are missing and there could be multiple delimiters.nnThe test need to be enhanced (and tested)n

issue.title: Yaml parsing problem
issue.body: Extracted from https://github.com/fabpot/yaml/issues/10:nnthe method 'parseQuotedScalar' is used for two purposes, parsing a delimited string, and a plain string, but when its being given a plain string, it still treats it as delimited, and thus only returns the first string it matches.nnIf you use something like this, it doesn't really work:nntest: 'don't do somthin' like that'nnyou'd get 'test' to simply equal 'don'.nni'm using this package to do a bit of yaml validation, so i added this snippit to the methodnn```nif ((!$delimiters) && (strlen($match[0]) < strlen($scalar))) {n  throw new InvalidArgumentException(sprintf('Malformed YAML (check your use of apostrophes and quotes): n %s.', substr($scalar, $i)));n}n```nnI'm sure this isn't the ideal fix, but I didn't want to battle with modifying the validation regex.n

issue.title: [Form] property path for violations is incorrect
issue.body: I have the following situation:nnThere is a form which shows a list of entities of some kind, kind of similar to a collection form. However, the entities need to be shown in some kind of hierarchy, so even though the app Data is a plain array, the clientData and form it self are built in the following way:nn```nform:n  Mon:n    0: entityn    1: entityn  Tue:n    0: entityn```nnetc...nnThe transformation between the two is done using a DataTransformer on the topmost form: https://gist.github.com/2419554nnThe form works fine except for validation, for some reason all errors bubble up all the way to the top form, even if they should display on the bottom forms (form.Mon.0, form.Mon.1, etc). While trying to find out what was wrong, I came to the conclusion that the property path of the violations was incorrect, or at least not conform to the way the form was build up:nndata[0].fieldndata[0].field2ndata[1].fieldnnrather thannndata[Mon][0].fieldndata[Mon][0].field2ndata[Mon][1].fieldnnThis causes them to bubble all the way up, as they cannot be mapped to the form.n

issue.title: [Form] form named 'search' with a field named 'search' => can't set default data
issue.body: A form class named 'search' with a single field named 'search' sent over GET leads to the following url:nn`````` /?search=mysearchstring```nIf the form is rendered using ```{{ form_widget(form) }}```nnI kinda like this behavior as it gives good looking url but on the other hand, you can't set default data properly.nn```$form->bindRequest($request);``` throws ```Expected argument of type 'array', 'string' given```.nn```phpn$defaultData = array('search' => $request->query->get('search', ''));n$form = $this->createForm(new SearchFormType(), $defaultData);n``````nnfills the search field with the string `Array`.nnWith a form named 'test' and a single field named 'test' you get the proper: `/?test[test]=mysearchstring`.nnWhy does 'search' provoke a unique behavior?nHow can I have a simple url (?search=mysearchstring) while not breaking default data setting?nnFor reference here is the class I use:nn``` phpn<?phpnnnamespace AcmeSiteBundleFormType;nnuse SymfonyComponentFormAbstractType;nuse SymfonyComponentFormFormBuilder;nnclass SearchFormType extends AbstractTypen{n    public function buildForm(FormBuilder $builder, array $options)n    {n        $buildern            ->add('search')n        ;n    }nn    public function getDefaultOptions(array $options)n    {n        return array(n            'csrf_protection' => false,n        );n    }nn    public function getName()n    {n        return 'search';n    }n}n```nnSymfony 2.0.11n

issue.title: [Form] Constraint Assert/Regex does not use HTML5 pattern attribute
issue.body: ``` phpn#Customer.phpnnclass Customer {n# (...)nn   /**n    * @var string $phonen    * @AssertNotBlank()n    * @AssertRegex('/^(d{2}) d{4}-d{4}$/')n    * @ORMColumn(name='phone', type='string', length=14)n    */n   private $phone;nn# (...)n}n```nn``` phpn#CustomerType.phpnnclass CustomerType extends AbstractTypen{n# (...)n   public function buildForm(FormBuilder $builder, array $options)n   {n       $buildern           ->add('phone', null, array('label' => 'Telefone'))n       ;n   }n# (...)n}n```nnHTML Result:nn``` htmln<input type='text' id='paggy_admin_customer_phone' name='paggy_admin_customer[phone]' required='required' maxlength='14' class='input-text'>n```nn_Workaround:_ If I add the 'pattern' property, duplicating the code of entity, it works as expected:nn``` phpn#CustomerType.phpnnclass CustomerType extends AbstractTypen{n# (...)n   public function buildForm(FormBuilder $builder, array $options)n   {n       $buildern           ->->add('phone', 'text', array('label' => 'Telefone', 'pattern' => '^n(d{2}) d{4}-d{4}$'))n       ;n   }n# (...)n}n```nnHTML Result:nn``` htmln<input type='text' id='paggy_admin_customer_phone' name='paggy_admin_customer[phone]' required='required' maxlength='14' pattern='^(d{2}) d{4}-d{4}$' class='input-text'>n```nnThanks!n

issue.title: [Form] Choice List in a Form
issue.body: Hi.nnHere is my form [ProductType](https://github.com/umpirsky/symfony-standard/blob/f59d47767a07bf1e06d55a2ebff13a13ae6aa199/src/Acme/DemoBundle/Form/ProductType.php) and [this](https://github.com/umpirsky/symfony-standard/blob/f59d47767a07bf1e06d55a2ebff13a13ae6aa199/src/Acme/DemoBundle/Controller/ProductController.php#L51) is how I use it in action.nnI expect it to render available categories in choice list, but it renders text field for category, I read the doc, and [this](http://epixa.com/2011/08/create-and-validate-a-choice-list-in-a-symfony-2-form.html) article, and tried the same, but all I get is a text field for category.nnIt renders available categories in choice list only if I remove [getDefaultOptions()](https://github.com/umpirsky/symfony-standard/blob/f59d47767a07bf1e06d55a2ebff13a13ae6aa199/src/Acme/DemoBundle/Form/ProductType.php#L23) from [ProductType](https://github.com/umpirsky/symfony-standard/blob/f59d47767a07bf1e06d55a2ebff13a13ae6aa199/src/Acme/DemoBundle/Form/ProductType.php) and explicitly pass [Product](https://github.com/umpirsky/symfony-standard/blob/f59d47767a07bf1e06d55a2ebff13a13ae6aa199/src/Acme/DemoBundle/Entity/Product.php) as a second parameter to [$this->createForm()](https://github.com/umpirsky/symfony-standard/blob/f59d47767a07bf1e06d55a2ebff13a13ae6aa199/src/Acme/DemoBundle/Controller/ProductController.php#L53), but I guess that is not the right way to do it.n
